comment: having beat the game without it breaking when it first came out, i would have given it a 610. but now with 2.0 its genuinely a 9.510 and phantom liberty is one of the best spy stories told period. goated

after 500 hours of gameplay in this game, im not really shy to say that this is easily one of the best stories ive ever played ever. the attention to detail of the city simply blows my mind, and the story will literally have you question your entire life. plus for my nerds that love to deep dive into the universe of games like these, the amount of world building lore is insane, and is rooted so much in reality. you simply cant find another gaming experience anywhere like this. buy it.
just wanted to say the quality of this video is amazing for someone with under 3k subs, great video thanks

it is so worth to save and playout all the options in the endings. the combinations are vast. sidenote  when you start the game, try to collect the money for the upgrades at victors first by engaging with streetthugs to gain some experience and points before you start the real storyline. this is especially handy when playing on the hardest level.
cyberpunk was worth it after patch 1.5. it's a 910 experience after phantom liberty and the only reason it doesn't get a 10 is the obviously cut content and shoddy launch.
with each generation of new gamers, this will be on their list of must play games ...it will never fade away because the story and world just so much fun to experience.
7 playthroughs in with diff builds and i don't see myself quitting anytime soon

i just finished kingdom come deliverance and bought cyberpunk today due to the discount on the xbox store. i was hesitant because of the negative reviews at its launch. however, the comments i see now about the game say it's one of the best. let's see if that's true.

my favorite game now, but its lightning in a bottle in a weird way. i just dont think they can bring it in a sequel. the launch version was very rough but i kept coming back because clearly it had a solid base that needed refinement. 2.0 did just that. the gameplay and world exploration is easy to get lost in, and writing in the 2020s that's not preachy, pretentious garbage is a godsend. i'll keep this installed well into the future, just as i do for doom, starcraft and a couple others whenever i get a new build done.

i went with a gunpowder build. spamming grenades and the arm cannon regenerates grenades pretty quickly and while any of those were on cooldown i'd switch to a revolver to finish off the remaining low hp enemies.

im glad i stuck with the game for more than a few hours in lol. i just bought it about two weeks ago. it went on sale. and quit after two hours in because oh my gosh, it is so slow in the beginning. but it picks up quick after you get out of the prologue. just stick in there for about four hours of the most agonizing four hours of an intro ever.
i specifically waited to play this until the ultimate edition glad i did, because i got to skip all the drama and am playing it for the first time with all the patches and dlc patience is a virtue

excellent video! i held off on buying it until it was on a discount, the bought it but didn't immediately start playing. finally fired it up four days ago and completely forgot that the real world exists. what an incredible gaming immersion! just taking my time through the game and enjoying how fresh it is but i know i will be playing through several times.

you talked me into it i've just parted with 22 of my hard earned for the base game. i've been umming and arring about this game for a long while and that's the cheapest i've seen it on xbox series s. you've convinced me it's a worthwhile purchase
i decided to buy this after your video thank you ill start it tonight! cant wait my first game on pc too

i bought the game in 2020, and it was unplayable on my pc, dumped it to the side and never looked back. four years later, i built a good spec pc and also ran out of games to play, looked back at my steam library, and gave it a try just to test the spec with rt, and omg, the game has blown me out of the water it is one of the best story games that i have played within the decade, with excellent graphics, great character development, awesome gameplay, and a beautiful narrative, one of the few games that i follow all the lines of the characters without skipping, and i love johnny.
it was broken but still fun when it came out, now it's great. they honestly should have waited to release
thanks for the thorough, well thought out review! i wasn't sure if i was going to purchase cyberpunk after all these years and now that it's on sale, you've convinced me! excited to try it.
i just started playing it yesterday last days of 2024 and let me tell ya, i'm addicted!

i bought it 2 days ago and thus far have been hooked. i can run around and screw with other criminals or the cops. i enjoy the story so far and the missions allow me to use my playstyle the way i want to. in other words the leveling and the gameplay allow me to be stealth instead of saying you can do it and taking it away once the action starts. it may change but i love the world so far.

friend of mine talked about cyberpunk and made me watch edgerunners which i loved. i then watched some gameplay with him and i couldn't stop being reminded of deus ex human revolutionmankind divided in a very good way and that the void the non existing third entry left wanted to be filled still. so i bit the bullet and bought the game and started playing. never regretted one bit, full enjoyment from start to finish, made me realize how incredible the cyberpunk universe and its concept were and how deep they could run and i'm probably going to go back to it every few years because the itch will need to be scratched. and while i've heard about the abysmal launch, you know there was a dedicated dev team in there because a game like that doesn't turn around without passion and it shows. i can't wait for orion or maybe a bit, just to be sure the game releases correctly, but i want to know what they're cooking already. next time i plan on making a ky kiske inspired build and using stuff like sandivistan has a pseudo roman cancel and the double jumpair dash options for movement. gonna be great i bet.

finished it this weekend, in about 95 hours, needed to recover emotionally a few times, specially after the phantom dlc and the face in city endbut perfect end after reload, fully in love with panam. what a masterpiece! you shared so much of how i experienced the game, thx  probably will restart the game because in the beginning i really had now clue what was going on

best ever, makes u laugh, cry, feel sorrow, love, and everything from warfare, crime prevention, friends, relations, dressup , tactics, racing, boxing, exploring, and whatever u can think of is in this game. to me 1010 and every modded game u play changes the game play..so u can change the game as u go along and makes it a different game. played 1.6  2.12and now 2.2  dlc.

got it on steam at early december 2024. i have been on the game for 110 hours so far, done with act 2 and halfway on phantom liberty missions i keep overlapping between these 2 and other side missions throughout my playthrough. i gotta say this is some of the best games i have been playing recently. there's still glitches in graphicvisual on npc in some occasions, but to me they are bearable so long as they don't break the immersion.

i think what i love most about cyberpunk is that it can be any game i want it to be depending on my mood. if i want a cozy experience i just drive or run around the city at night and take in the sights. if i want action, the game gives me so many options for incredible combat. if i want a story this game's world is so unbelievably big and detailed that every time i play i feel like i discover something new even hundreds of hours in.

i've had this game since launch, and i'm just now playing it. omg! i've never been into these type of games, and at 50 years old, i think i've been gaming wrong all this time. i've been attached to my duel sense edge, non stop for about a week.
playing a net runnerkatana build was about the most fun id ever had in a video game. might be time for a replay.

started playing on pc finally in 2024 and im still playing and having a great time. playing it methodically to where it makes sense with the pl dlc and its been pretty amazing. night city is so cool and the detail is just unreal. sometimes i just find myself walking around and taking it all in. you know its immersive when theres a fast travel on every corner and you never use them.

i've played since day 1 on pc. always liked the game, but after my last playthrough, where i got all the remaining achievements, including all the endings, i can honestly say this is one of my favorite games ever. it's up there with mass effect and bungie halo, and that's saying a lot! i haven't been this interested in a universe since i was a young boy playing halo 2. i'm 29 now... this game deserves all the praise in the world. from the music to the setting, the visuals, to the story, acting and worldbuilding, it is perfect. every character is just so damn interesting and with some of them, you'll slowly start to build an opinion of them like they were a real person. without spoiling too much, expect a dark story regardless of your choices. night city has a way of... twisting one's perception. it's almost a therapeutic experience, not even kidding. if you love scifi stories, then buy this game!

i absolutely love cyberpunk. down to every little detail of gamplay, world, music, weapons, skills, tech, characters, all of it. i got the game when it came out and i was disappointed i will say. but cd projekt red have put so much work into fixing the game that it is 100 one of my favorite if not absolutely my favorite game of all time. i didn't play much when the game first released, but i did play once they started fixing some of the issues. i did a play through as a nomad and ended with the panam story. maybe 60 to 80 hours. then i eventually replayed the game as a corpo and did every side mission possible and 100 the game as far as i could and had every ending possible except takamura. had around 170 to 190 hours. i haven't played since they've released phantom liberty and the massive update to go with it due the dlc and update wasn't available for ps4. but i can promise the moment i get a ps5, whenever that may be, cyberpunk will be the first game i play and i will try to 100 again. anyways i just wanted to take a second to say that i love the game, and i hope that anyone who didn't like the game or didn't want to play the game due to its original release, i highly highly recommend giving it a chance. i truly don't believe you'd be disappointed.

in case someone missed the secret message at the end set resolution to 4k, play back speed to 0.25, fast forward to 137, play frame by frame, and pause when there's a background full of red text, for those who are inpatient, there it is its been over 2077 days since we announced our plan to develop cyberpunk 2077. we released a cgi trailer, gave some interviews and went dark. normal procedure for these kinds of things  you announce a game and then shut up, roll up your sleeves and get to work. we wanted to give you the witcher 3 and both expansions first, which is why this period of staying silent was longer than we planned. sorry for that. as soon as we concluded work on blood and wine, we were able to go full speed ahead with cp2077s preproduction. but we chose to remain silent. why? at some point we made the decisions to resume talking about the game when we have something to show. something meaningful and substantial. this is because we do realize youve been impatiently waiting for a very long time, and we wouldnt like anyone to feel that were taking this for granted. on the contrary  it gives us a lot of extra motivation. the hype is real, so the sweat and tears need to be real, too  but to the point. today is the day. if youre seeing this, it means you saw the trailer.  our vision for cyberpunk, an alternative version of the future where america is in pieces, megacorporations control all aspects of civilized life, and gangs rule the rest. and, while this world is full of adrenaline, dont let the car chases and guns mislead you. cyberpunk 2077 is a true single player, storydriven rpg. youll be able to create your own character and well, youll get to know the rest of what show at our booth at e3. be on the lookout for the previews! before we finish, you probably have some questions, when? when we told you we would only release the game when its ready, we meant it. were definitely much closer to a release date than we were back then  but its still not the time to confirm anything, so patience is still required. quality is the only thing that drives us. its the beauty of being an independent studio and your own publisher. how big? seriously big, but to be honest, we have no bloody clue at this point in time. once we put it all together, we will openly tell you what you can expect. and we promise well do this before we start talking about preorders or ask anything of you. free dlcexpansionsdrm expect nothing less than you got with the witcher 3. as for drm, cp2077, will be 100 drmfree on pc. microtransactions? in a single player roleplaying game? are you nuts? once again, thank you for your patience. if you have a minute, do visit cyberpunk.net and share your opinion about anything with us. we read everything you posted we treat it very seriously. yours, cd projekt red team

at 139 there's a message from cdpr, in case if anyone missed. it reads it's been over 2077 days since we announced our plan to develop cyberpunk 2077. we released a cgi trailer, gave some interviews and... went dark. normal procedure for these kinds of things  you announce a game then shut up, roll up your sleeves and go to work. we wanted to give you the witcher 3 and both expansions first, which is why this period of staying silent was longer than we planned. sorry for that. as soon as we concluded work on blood and wine, we were able to go full speed ahead with cp2077's preproduction. but we chose to remain silent. why? at some point, we made a decision to resume talking about the game only when we have something to show. something meaningful and substantial. this is because we do realize you've been impatiently waiting for a very long time, and we wouldn't like anyone to feel that we're taking this for granted. on the contrary  it gives us a lot of extra motivation. the hype is real, so the sweat and tears need to be real, too  but, to the point. today is the day. if you're seeing this, it means you saw the trailer  our vision of cyberpunk, an alternative version of the future where america is jin pieces, megacorporations control all aspects of civilized life, and gangs rule the rest. and, while this world is full of adrenaline, don't let the car chases and guns mislead you. cyberpunk 2077 us a true single player, storydriven rpg. you'll be able to create your own character and... well, you'll get to know the rest from what we show at our booth at e3. be on the lookout for the previews! before we finish, you probably have some questions, right? 1. when? when we told you we would only release the game when it's ready, we meant it. we're definitely much closer to a release date than we were back then , but it's still not the time to confirm anything, so patience is still required. quality is the only thing that drives us  it's beauty of being an independent studio and your own publisher. 2 how big? seriously big, but..., to be honest, we have no bloody clue at this point in time. once we put it all together, we will openly tell you what you can expect. and we promise we'll do this before we start taking any preorders or ask anything of you. 3.free dlcexpansionsdrm? expect nothing less than you got with the witcher 3. as for drm, cp2077 will be 100 drmfree on pc. 4.microtransactions? in a singleplayer game? are you nuts? once again, thank you for your patience. if you have a minute, do visit cyberpunk.net and share you opinion about anything with us. we read everything you post and we treat it very seriously. yours, cd project red team

when we told you we would only release the game when it's ready, we meant it. we're definitely much, much closer to a release date than we were back then , but it's still not the time to confirm anything, so patience is still required. quality is the only thing that drives us  it's the beauty of being an independent studio and your own publisher. 2. how big? expect nothing less than you got with the witcher 3. as for drm, cyberpunk 2077 will be 100 drmfree for pc. 4. mictrotransactions? in a single player roleplaying game? are you nuts? once again, thank you for your patience, if you have a minute, do visit cyerpunk.net and share your opinion about anything with us. we read everything you post and we treat it very seriously. yours, cd project red team it took me about one hour to copy it and write it here on a mobile. i would be very glad, if you guys could upvote this comment, so everybody sees this. and as always, cd project red already has my money. cheers!

i love the fact that they named the first ripper doc that you meet in the game viktor. later on, when he revives v, they say something about feeling like frankenstein. there are several other easter eggs too, all which make it very clear that the devs were making an allusion to dr. victor frankenstein.

one that ought to be on this list is that you can head down to the beach by pacifica lefthandside of the map, run up and down the entire beach killing all the enemies you see. there's enough there to keep cycling their respawns endlessly without having to leave the area, and they have a decent chance of dropping those booster shards. it's an insanely quick way to powerlevel your street cred and make some serious bank in the process, with a selling point at each end of the beach! i believe i was making about 40k eddies per inventoryload.
you can no longer buy crafting components from vendors in the game. all components are either found or acquired through dismantling now.
if you have a problem with too much item weight you can just call your car and access your stash from the trunk. unload and fast travel.

btw for anyone who is currently struggling  nash's container was updated! it now requires you to have 40 street cred! it will pop up as a side mission and will spawn any time of day! i learned this from another video after losing my mind looking for this damn container for 30 minutes reloading the save, skipping time, reopening the game, and driving through the damn tunnel about 18 times

there's a hidden quest in watson called i'm in love with my car you can look it up online for quest location. it gives you one of the best cars in this game basically a quadra type66 but with guns. so don't miss it if you haven't got it yet.
11  some junk vendors can sell perk points and skill xp shards 12  food vendors sell items that permanently buff you. these are very small, like 2 sta regen, but still.
dash and katana bullet deflection deserve honorable mention as well in 2.0

the real quickhack you shouldn't sleep on is sonic shock at tier 4 or higher. it effectively erases an enemy's presence from their allies, allowing you to take them out without anyone noticing via whatever quiet method you want to use, a silenced weapon, a quickhack, a thrown knife, or a blade. it's like memory wipe, but better, and cheaper.
im so proud of cd for nit giving up. absolute studs.

if theres one thing i learned from the dlc, it's that misty is the pnly friend who will stay with you through thick and thin, everyone else moved on and no longer wants to be associated with you after your 3 years coma. amazing how v sacrificed many things for these friends and was there for them in their times of need but they arent there for you in your dire time of need.

best balance i've found for me in terms of crafting mats  credits any tier below what i'm equipped with meaning if i have blue weapons and chrome i sell at vendors in our example of having blue gear, we'd sell green and white weapons and dismantle blues i get for crafting materials to upgrade to the next tier. soon enough blue gear will be replace and any blue items get added to the sale pool. the reason this works is that i pick up enough broken weapons for lowtier crafting mats that i can just craft them into higher tier materials when combined with the weapons i dismantle. once i hit 500k eddies, i dismantle everything and rely on payouts from gigs to keep it afloat from there.

the quest for the free caliburn used to pop up at 40 street cred with a marker on the map. i don't know if i missed it this time or they moved it to hidden quests. there is also a weaponized quadra, a tribute to ken block, for free in watson. and if you are a bit patient for money when you hack into things at 40 you get legendary quickhacks which sell 20k a piece.

regarding 8  i had the perk where hacking a netrunner who is hacking you spreads what youre quickhacking onto multiple enemies. a netrunner was hacking me and i hit them with cyberpsychosis. next thing i know, 8 of them were all cyberpsychos fighting each other.

here's a tip don't put off finishing the game. you get some bonuses for finishing the game that carryover to your character after you finish the game. for example, if you loot the final boss, you can go to his ship after the game and get a crafting spec for an incredibly powerful smart shotgun that shoots rockets and gives you stack of pyromania if you have that perk. depending on which ending you do, you can get exclusive iconic weapons, such an assault rifle for doing the final mission with rogue or an iconic revolver if you do the final mission with the aldecaldos. as i said, you can continue to use these weapons with your character after finishing the game, and use them while doing phantom liberty. the smart shotgun i mentioned earlier is incredibly useful, especially on very hard and even more so if you have pyromania.
man, been playing the shizz outta this game again since phantom liberty dropped, and it just flat out slaps. such a great game!!!

i cant remember the perk names but its in intelligence and it allows you to hack the net runner through cover and then that hack spreads to all the enemies around. theres been a couple times where ive had a whole base do suicide at once. really fun. totally recommend. i think its 3 perks, one to identify them, one to hack them through cover and one to spread your hack to all their friends.

915  alternatively, call up any of your available vehicles, as they have a storage at their back even the motorcycles, which you can access at any time and unload anything you don't want to carry at the moment. just gotta make sure to be near a road and not in the middle of most missions as they tend to disable your ability to call your ride.

disassembling clothes instead of weapons is bad advice for gaining crafting components, because clothes always give 1 component, while weapons give 5 or more if the weapon had mods on it. a 5 tier weapon gives 15 components compared to 1 from tier 5 clothing.
that free sports car in the cave is also part of a huge batman reference easter egg, so have fun with that lol

quick note for anyone just starting to use hidden dragon you need airtime to get it. it used to be that double jumping right beside the target was enough, but it seems that after 2.0 you need a bit extra height to make it happen.

as a net runner i can't remember the last time i was anywhere near the line of fire, thus weapon glitch was fairly useless. using a combination of intelligence, tech and cool i'd approach a building by stealth from a neighboring roof if possible and hack into the cameras. using contagion, and a raven cyberdeck i could clear an entire building in under a minute in most cases. any stragglers were marked, pinged, and zeroed curtesy of the rounds my tech sniper rifle shot through their skulls. before the phantom liberty patch, i didn't even need the rifle.
i personally liked the fortified ankles cyberware upgrade for charged jumps. you jump way higher with that mod compared to reinforced tendons.
for the free car, pretty sure you have to have a street cred of 40 so thats not early game anymore. i just started a new choom and there was no car yet with a street cred of 32
i use the sprint speed legs instead of the jump legs. i just find it more useful, especially with a squishy build since some perks make you harder to hit the faster you are moving.

for the raycaster you need to unlock the crate first to get the car. regarding enemies trying to hack you they have a proximity to their hacks. if you run a good distance away from them you could cause fails because they don't have a good range to effect you. i normally don't use cameras to hack enemies because you would always alert everyone and blow stealth. it's best to room to room deal with guys that way although it's harder but you won't blow stealth if you're good enough. i play on max difficulty.

do ncpd missions. they're quick straightforward objective, generally pretty easy, and you get a cash payout as well as the weapons the enemies use, plus a boat load of skills shards and occasionally a iconic weaponschematic.

two more tips pick up everything  you can convert junk into common crafting componenets and then convert them to green components for a 5 to 1 ratio. this will give you more components and level up your engineering skill. winwin visit food vendors  there are some later food and drink items that give permanent bonuses

i played the game the first time ever the past month, and i found the immobility quickhack super useful in the base game don't have phantom liberty yet. i found it insanely useful against melee enemies if you get the perk to, i think double, the length of control hacks on 100 health units. i've had situations where i root one in place with the last of my ram, and smart gun the now worthless enemy from max to dead with just one use of that quickhack, even on very hard.

clothing only nets you one crafting component of the associated tier, weapons grant you either 5 or 7 if it's a  tier, and once you get into tier 5, the give you 15. money is way easier to get just through breaching access points and selling the plethora of quickhacks you acquire. i easily sell enough to take all of a vendors money while still having a shit ton left over.

don't listen to the advice against breaking down gray weapons for components, you can only upgrade iconic weapons however all cyberware is upgradable and there not cheap on component costs and components are harder to acquire in terms of farming especially after 2.01

there's another free car that you can get which has become my favorite car in the game. it's a hooned out police cruiser i think and it's so much fun. i found it during one of the delamain missions where you have to find the rogue cars. there's one that you follow through a warehouse and while going through it silverhand appears and says you should try to get into the car. it's locked but the keys are nearby. once you find them, the car is yours. i don't fast travel anymore because it's way more fun to rip through night city in this thing.

for those wondering, here's the fixer rewards regina jones pre 2.0 legendary neofiber 2.0 and up axolotl, the iconic variant of newton module. also the only nonos iconic cyberware that can be acquired outside of dogtown. wakako okada byakko, an iconic katana that grants leap attacks and an attack speed increase after each kill. padre sebastian ibarra seraph, an iconic liberty pistol that fires explosive rounds. el capitan muamar reyes bloody maria, an iconic m2308 tactician shotgun with greatly increased chance at dismembering opponents. dakota smith thorton mackinaw saguaro, a cactus colored truck built for off roading. dino dinovic a quadra type66 540 with a bullitt mustang paint scheme dark highland green with black rims. mr. hands 2.0 a sterling silver quadra sport r7

couple extras 1. if you turn down panams choice, you get the archer quartz car, but it locks you out of a lot of stuff as its necessary for her side gigs and romance questline. theres also an iconic weapon during the revenge rampage you go on that you wont get otherwise. the car will be added to the auto fixer a couple days later, so youre way better off just buying it. 2. if youre doing a netrunner build, you can use one of your relic perks to add the weapon glitch quick hack to your monowire and apply it with charged hits. personally, i think doing the movement one is better because applying it improves follow up attacks with the monowire, but the option is there.
regarding the double jump, another option alternate is fortified ankles. these don't let you double jump but they do allow you to charge up a single but much higher jump

the best enemy netrunner deterrent is the self ice cyberware and the perk where you can upload a quickhack through walls against netrunners trying to quickhack you. there's also a perk where you have a chance to spread your quickhack to other enemies within range of the enemy netrunner. i was lucky enough to system collapse an enemy netrunner, which spread to 6 additional enemies around them. all of them instacrashed, which was exciting and rewarding.

great video, i still tend to forget to sleep before missions and i'm on my second playthrough d couple useful things that you didn't mention came to mind regarding enemy quickhacks, selfice is a must have no matter what type of a build you're going for, it negates an enemy quickhack every time. well, it has a cooldown of course so maybe not each and every one but most of the time its works perfectly and upgrading it decreases the cooldown and it's one less thing you need to worry about in combat bloodpumpbiomonitor combo is another must imo because it's essentially an autoheal so that's also one less thing you need to worry about in combat. and furthermore, if you invest perk points improving healing items and health regen, you can make v almost invincible d

one of the biggest quality of life recommendations i could ever give to a netrunner build is to run the blood pump cyberware with biomon and take the health regen perks as well as adrenaline in the body tree, specifically pick up the tier 1 body perk dorphhead, which causes you to gain 2 seconds of 100 mitigation chance, this in conjunction with adrenaline lets you very easily spam quickhacks while somehow tanking the everloving crap out of incoming fire. this lets you constantly spam quickhacks, i like spamming tier 5 synapse burn and use it in conjunction with the cox2 cybernetic for easily upwards of 2k damage per quickhack since it makes all quickhacks autocrit truly amazing cyberware for netrunning, upgrading it to tier 5 decreases the max ram penalty to only 4, so it's super worth it

the issue with implementing 1st3rd is that both cant have the same level of quality due to engine limitations. don't be fooled by the unreal engine demo...a demo that was designed from the ground up for 3rd person only and animation based movement. your camera choice is highly dependant on how you want your engine to handle movement. you literally have to cater to one even if you've implemented both. so you end up in a situation where you can clearly see that one of the 2 is favored from the game design. gtard2 and skyrimfallout more recently avowed as well are perfect examples of this. its so obvious that skyrimfallout is 1st person designed, everything is made to cater to 1st person like 0 animation base movement which is why their 3rd person camera looks stiff and the character feels floaty. vice versa for gtardr2. they both have animation based movement and the entire design of the game is based around that, then you switch to 1st person and it looks like you're playing a chucky cheese arcade shooter since the camera is slogging around with every input because its tied to animation based movement. if anyone tells you that fallout 3rd person mode hits the same standards of your avg tps game gameplay wise then theyre lying to you. same for if anyone says rdr2 1st person mode hits the standards of your avg fps game.

honestly, if they want to pick a different engine rather than maintain it themselves and require one that can handle crowds then they could do a lot worse than speaking to saber interactive as their saber3d engine seems a lot more robust than ue5. no idea where epic went so badly wrong with the shift from ue4 but something happened.

witcher and cyberpunk used the same engine, but the character rigging for v was definitely not set up to view third person  just watch your shadow when crouching... it's not that it's not possible, but that it would change various behaviors if they adjusted the rigging to look good, which would likely require several environment changes to accommodate the different crouch height, or maybe some other broadreaching tweaks that would be a lot of work. hopefully the new game will have a third person option, or at least live reflections since ue5 can certainly do this efficiently.

just an fyi when it comes to sidequestssidecontent  some of them transform into storylines that continue as you progress in the main story. one big problem in this game is when you say no, it genuinely means no. you literally cannot enter that mission or storyline unless you got a save before it. if a character calls you about a mission, best bet is say yes  you do not have a time limit or anything for all of them, but saying no locks you out of it also game is save based like skyrim so make sure u find a comfortable quicksave  quickload button

a few tips from a launch player  1. only way to encounter smasher is to beat the game. there are multiple endings. 2. ncpd gigs on map are ez xp and money sources with lil to no effect on the main story. 3. do side quests. the city is dense just explore in general. 4. some side quests are timed. 5. loot all the things. they all have a use. 6. do not delete iconic weapons. 7. attributes max at 20. spend wisely you won't be able to max them all without mods. welcome to night city choom

209 where is a hidden message from cdpr team. the wait for cyberpunk 2077 is almost over. it's been quite the journey, and first of all we want to thank all of you for being with us along the way. we know there's a fair amount of anticipation for the game, and very soon you will all be able to decide whether or not we lived up to the hype. launch day is always a mix of excitement and constant nervewracking, and with this being the first game we've developed that isn't titled 'the witcher', we'd be lying if we said we weren't anxious to see what you think once you've sunk your teeth into it. with this launch trailer, we're just about ready to flick the switch and see cyberpunk 2077 go from ours to become yours. we set out to create our most immersive world yet, and we believe that the stories waiting for you to uncover, and the relationships you'll forge during your time in night city, will stick with you for quite some time. we've mentioned before that expansions will be coming, and while we're not ready to talk specifics just yet, we will say that we've learned a lot from our work on both hearts of stone  blood and wine. our planned expansions will take you even deeper into the world of cyberpunk 2077 offering substantial, storydriven content that'll give you tough choices to make through impactful narratives that you won't soon forget. but before we get there, we'll first be kicking off our free dlc program in early 2021. just like with the witcher 3, expect an assortment of free dlc packs to begin hitting night city, dropping a bunch of cool stuff that'll inject even more life into the world of the dark future. we hope you're looking forward to them! we want to end this message with a request. once you playfinished the game, we would love it if you got back to us and told us who your v was. our forums and social media are there for you. we want to know how you found night city and what choices you made. we created a huge world for you to jump into, tell us your story. cd project red team

i completed cyberpunk in 2024 because i hadn't seen it as something interesting before... but how wrong i was. i'm 30 years old, and when i finished the game, i cried like a child during the credits. now, six months later, i'm watching the trailer again, and it feels completely different, but my eyes are still wet. the best game! the best story! the best soundtracks! an incredible combination of all these things! this is a game that will leave its mark on your mind and even your soul. this is a game that will awaken all your emotions. this is a game that will make you both rejoice and suffer. this is a game you will remember forever. this is a game that will make you think. thank you, cd projekt red! good luck and enjoy the game to those who are just starting their journey in nightcity!

i feel like every single player game, or otherwise moddable game, should focus on mod support after release. mod support is one of the biggest things i look for when looking to buy a game. the issue with moddable games today is that official updates break a lot of mods. this is because a lot of mods rely on utility mods. those utility mods dig into games deeper than what was designed for, but give modders the ability to do way more than what was designed. if the default modding api were good enough, utility mods likely wouldn't be needed, and mods would no longer break each update. it would also make it way easier to mod things in general. i think new applicable games should be created with modding in mind from the start. it's a lot more work to go back and make the game moddable vs designing the game that way from the beginning. i think it's both a good habit and also makes it faster to add the same type of content in the future, even for the game developers themselves.

another thing worth remembering is that cyberpunk, despite its age, has one of the most cutting edge ray tracing implementations on the market, and is still used by nvidia to show off their latest tech, which no doubt benefits cdpr. the recent addition for dlss 4 is a massive upgrade over the old upscaling model. with the recent addition of mega geometry in allan wake 2, which not only increases the quality of ray tracing, but also dramatically boosts ray tracing performance even allowing the 2080 run their heaviest rt settings at 30 fps it wouldn't surprise me if this tech eventually made its way to cyberpunk, which would open up path tracing to a lot of people who couldn't run it before. there are also rumours that cyberpunk will come to the switch 2 within the launch window not on launch day

to be fair the floating fire bug still exist, they just fixed it in certain places. sometimes you find piles of trashbags on fire. those are still susceptible to the issue. if you run a car through the trash or toss a grenade at it to collapse the pile the fire just floats. also, i wouldn't say most cars can be crystalcoat swapped cause that's not correct. only a handful of cars can be recoated currently. not a single thorton at this time can be recoated and some of the cars don't have the coats applied to them correctly. for instance the vtech, using basic color coats on it results in portions of the gold decals on the base paintjob to not disappear so it screws up the whole look unless you use the base coat or a unique for it. btw, you missed a feature of the traffic improvements. not only do they now navigate around. if you hold them up for too long, they'll eventually just go into road rage mode and try to ram you out of the way. also, the leaning back and forth on bikes isn't just for stunts, it actually affects the weight of the bike. if you lean forward, it will pull the back wheel off the ground. if you lean back, it pulls the front wheel off the ground. this is really useful for faster bikes like the kusanagi that usually have issues turning. by leaning forward, you put the weight on where the bike will pivot, so it turns more cleanly. basically, just lean into the turn like you would on a real motorcycle. you can also use it to brake faster if you tap your input to lean back while using breaks since it forces the rear wheel against the ground it makes it stop faster. that might not be intentional but it works. i did a lot of testing with bikes on my last playthrough. difference with bikes is night and day.

some of the best characters in gaming. a comeback story for the ages. so glad cdpr was able to redeem their name with these last few updates

cdpr definitely were not tight lipped. they were promising all sorts of things that were not in the game at launch. they were the ones driving the hype train. that's why our expectations were so high.
as one of few people who loved cp2077 on launch, this comeback will go down as one of my all time favorite things to ever happen in the gaming industry.

in a timeline and generation where keeping people's attention for longer than 30 seconds is objectively difficult, in a world where no matter what you discover there's something else as cool or cooler, in a realm video games where the markets are so oversaturated with content and clones and attempts at all genres... i'm really really happy you guys made a video about the comeback story of this game. this game ended up so much better than i could have ever imagined.

i played cyberpunk twice right after its release on pc. the excellent plot, beautiful world and amazing music drew me deeply into this world. there were mistakes when playing three years ago, but i don't even remember them anymore and they didn't stop me from having a great time. now with the addition of phantom liberty, i played the game again from the very beginning and had even more fun. i love driving the quadra type66 javelin around a crowded city, it gives me more satisfaction than playing forza horizon. good job cd projekt and i'm waiting for your next games

im 47, been a gamer since i can remember, since pong i guess, but latest years i havent played that much due to work, etc. and i was starting to think my gamer life was dying...because i didnt enjoy games the way i did with the witcher 3, resident evil, assasins creed,etc. but then i got cyberpunk 2077 and i am back...im over 60 hrs into the game and i cant get enough..i feel like a child again...the landscape...the open world...soooo many quests i feel i have attention disorder lol . thanks cyberpunk 2077 for saving my gamer life...thanks cd project red for creating and fixing this game. i cant wait to get a ps5 to play the dlc. you did it again cd project red. you witchered cyberpunk. btw i play on ps4....no bugs or issues yet. i already watched the series and loved it.

i like cyberpunk being in a good place now. i was a fan of the game from launch because of the amazing world they built and the gripping story they created. i know and dont deny the issues the game had at launch but i still thoroughly enjoyed it so seeing others see what i saw possible from the beginning is incredible.

at it's core, cyberpunk 2077 had a lot of great things going for it. the narrative was very strong and the combat was a lot of fun so there was always a good game there. if it didn't release on last gen consoles it probably wouldn't have received all the flak it got. this game really turned around when edgerunners was released on netflix and they implemented some much needed fixes and cool content from the tv series.
i only recently started playing on v2.02, it's honestly one of my favorite games of all time so far. what a blast. i'm glad i didn't start playing at launch.
i picked up cyberpunk just last week, oh my v, now i doubt my own existence

as someone who played this game when it first launched back in 2020, it's amazing to see this crazy comeback and refreshing to see devs actually care for their game and understand that they messed up and did everything in their power to fix and boost it into what it is now. personally, i never really experienced any issues with the game other than it randomly crashing on a constant basis but to see where it is now is mindblowing, and as someone who does not like firstperson games, cyberpunk 2077 is easily one my favorite firstperson games i've ever played. from the story to the characters to the world to the combat, just an amazing experience from start to finish. can honestly say i'm looking very forward to cyberpunk 2, especially with the switch to ue5.

i only just bought cyberpunk 2077 this year 2023 and it is one of my top 5 favourite games currently. then with patch 2.1 and i recently upgraded to an rtx 4060 ti gpu, the graphics are wow. but it's the story and characters that make it the experience that it is. also, it gets top marks from me for having no happy endings, no matter what choices you make. one thing i don't get with people is the obession over character outfits. really, the only time you can look at your character are in the wardrobe, in the mirror or when you are sitting on a motorcycle. so the outfits really aren't important, especially as the npc's don't react to your outfit. it would be more interesting if you were dressed in a corpo outfit, walked into a santo domingo bar and someone tells you that you aren't welcome there. but still, one of my top 5 games!

i bought the game just before phantom liberty came out because it was on sale so i decided to give it a chance and my god this game is so good. i knew that on launch back in 2020 the game was in a nearly unplayable state, but i didnt know so many of the features i'm seeing and experiencing in my playthrough were added after the fact. i cant imagine how it is for people who played the game at release and then seeing it now, it must feel like a completely new and different game entirely. i never followed the hype for this game over the years leading up to it's release, i didnt really know it existed until that e3 where keanu reeves did the you're breathtaking segment. i had no expectations for the game like so many others did, so when it came out and i saw how glitchy and poorly optimized it was i just had some laughs at its expense and moved on. it wasnt until 3 years later that i decided to give it a chance after cdpr turned it around and i'm so glad i did. i just wish the game originally released like this so they didn't have to make a huge comeback in the first place.

when i first played cyberpunk, i played on a 2013 xbox one, and i did not have a horrible experience... yes there were bugs, glitches and some broken things but i still had a great experience overall. by the time phantom liberty came out, i got a series x and decided to load up and replay the game, and wow! i then fully understood what all the fuss was about around 60fps, it was like a whole new game! at the end of phantom liberty i had the same bittersweet feeling i get after watching a really good scifi actiondrama, this was the second time cyberpunk channeled the spirit of the original blade runner film for me.

i started playing cyberpunk 2077 back in march 2024. i didn't know what to expect and i missed most of the catastrophic launch event, since i was neck deep in my career at the time. i was unaware of many things around this game, in fact, but i do remember hearing some of the commotion from close friends. going into this game without expectation, the game blew me away. not just in the visuals, but with everything else in it. i can say with confidence that this has become my favorite game to play. i now have 900 hours burned in pretty sure i'm going cross 1500 hours at some point and i'm on my second complete run, role playing as a nomad. i absolutely love the cyberpunk theme. i actually got really good at this game too and it just feeds my addiction even further. cyberpunk 2077 is a masterpiece and i give 0 fucks if anyone disagrees. after learning about the whole debacle, i definitely understand most of the disappointment, especially for ps4 users... ouch! i hope cdpr never does this again and that they've learned from this experience and will avoid it at all costs with their upcoming games. if you've ever felt the itch to try something different, give cyberpunk 2077 a try. phantom liberty is phenomenal.

i bought cyberpunk 2077 a bit more than a year after its bad launch. aside from a few crashes and bugs it ran well, but at first i've got too overwhelmed by all the different builds and systems and guns and whatnot. so i took a step back, played other games then started watching tips and tricks videos on yt about the things above. they helped me a lot to understand the old skill tree and game mechanics. a shout out to all the youtubers who helped me with their videos!  and once i understood the game better, i've got hooked. first the worldexploring and the side quests grabbed me, then the main story and lore sucked me in too. i finally recorded and finished my first playthrough with male v in may this year. and i was floored by how good my overall experience was! after a short break to play other games, at the end of the summer, i went back for a 2nd playthrough with female v before phantom liberty. and i couldn't stop playing ever since. especially since the updates started coming and they'd improved and added so much! most i really love. phantom liberty was a really good dlc too just finished my 2nd playthrough of it , and after getting the last ending of the four, i have 100ed both the main game and the dlc! my very first platinum trophy is from cp 2077! and i just got my very last trophy in the dlc too!!!  this has never ever happened to me before! so this is a very clear proof  to me at least  that cp 2077 is indeed phenomenal now and deserves a second chance and the praise for the cdpr devs not abandoning it, for putting all the effort, money, dedication and passion into correcting that mistake and giving us the game cp 2077 was, i believe, always meant to be! because despite the rocky start both the game's and my personal initial struggles, this game became one of my very favorite open world games and gaming soundtracks of all time! so yes, i agree, the devs very much deserve the credit where it's due, and they did redeem themselves in my eyes with all the hard work they'd put in since the launch. i wish more studios would learn, listen and care like this!

where are you getting the .500 sw from? the dr5 nova is specifically described and shown as a more lowpower weapon that is cheap and easy to use, hence why it's mainly found among less than skilled beat cops or gang members. if you want to go off game stats, the malorian overture you also mentioned in the video is specifically described as a .42 caliber revolver, and it does 128 damage per shot, whereas the nova does 106. beyond that, if you look at the concept art for the nova, posted in a large art collection by mikhail solovarov on artstation, the rounds are rather clearly much smaller and shorter than .500 sw or even .42. so i don't know where that information is specifically coming from, or if that's just an assumption on your part. as for it being a good design, i agree it's a good design aesthetically and fits the world, though as a practical weapon that's a whole other discussion, one which to be honest i don't feel getting into and one that i am not a genuine expert with to comment on.

never ever neglect those crafting techs. some iconic weapons can't be crafted without it, and others will never make it to legendary rarity without it. some of those are the best or most unique weapons in the game as well, so don't skimp out on that, but feel free to take a little bit of time to get there once you figure out how many points the game will limit you to. planning your build is a good thing, and makes a frustrating experience into a great one when your character can actually work.

first of all, despite the fact that v is a bit too fast, the ergonomics of the gunfight are more or less fps acceptable, the fov, animations, sway, aiming and everything that plays a major role in a fps shooter fits well with this game. i have problems playing starfield now due to the exactly same fact, starfield is not ergonomic when it comes to gunplay, it's stiff and causes nausea. cyberpunk fits much more and sometimes the gunplay reminds me of a bf4, guns are properly modeled, have been correctly placed in front of the camera at the exact angle they should be, the render feels very natural, both of them. the way that most fps games render guns is by rendering the background everything except the gun and then pasting another render with just your arms and a weapon on top of it, that's why sometimes in some games you can see your weapon clipping through a wall and sometimes you can't. problems raises when we are asked to place the rendered weapon on top of a game world, if both renders have different aligments, whether it's caused by fov or bad dev work means the same, the game feels unnatural, stiff as fuck and causes nausea.

don't forget about la chingona dorada, jackie's guns. you can get them by returning to his ofrenda sometime after doing the actual quest where you take part in his ofrenda. you have to have the quest done, but you don't get them as part of the quest, it also counts as finding them in the open world. it's the only iconic weapon you can naturally have two of because jackie doubletriggered them, and they have a cool passive that gives you extra ammo everytime you equip the gun, scaling with how many headshots you hit, which means you can switch between them constantly and keep getting extra ammo and never run out of bullets. assuming you hit the headshots, ofc.

i played the older version of cyberpunk when it first came out, and back then, iconic weapons had serious damage potential. unlike now, you had to raise your tech skill in order to craft high quality items a feature i kinda wish they brought back and as a result crafted epic and legendary weapons did some serious damage to cover the opportunity cost. iconic weapons in particular, however, had some absolutely wild powerscaling back then, and in most cases getting any given iconic weapon from common to legendary quality would often give it a dps of well over a thousand. i started replaying the game recently and now i feel like i rarely touch the iconic weapons, which makes me feel bad because they often have some pretty interesting gimmicks behind them fenrir is op lmao.

im incredibly grateful that cdpr decided to continue supporting the game despite previously saying otherwise. 2.2 was most certainly a welcome surprise. not to sound greedy but cdpr should focus a some attention towards creating more content for this game. now, im in no way saying it should be phantom liberty tier content, but it would be a very welcomed addition to us all if they dropped a smallerscaled dlc such as a casino heist story for instance along with new gigs and ncpd scanners. maybe even the addition of radiant quests. ive been gaming since the 90s and i can confidently say that cyberpunk 2077 is my favorite game of all time and one of the best games ever developed. despite the early hurdles it overall proved to be a resounding success and i find it baffling that the team has decided to produce only one, single dlc and more or less shelve the game. a game this great deserves a at least one more addition. cdpr exhausted a commendable level of time, energy and finances improving and polishing this game that it stands today as very technically impressive alongside its overall dynamics that entrance the player in such a unique way that it stands leagues above most other titles within a similar genre. i really do think it would serve everyones interests in dedicating a small yet effective team of devs towards producing reasonablysized dlc products for 2077 while the rest continue focusing on project orion. i really do feel that cyberpunk 2077 as it stands now is left largely untapped in its immense potential for continued support.

for anyone who wants a more in depth explaination about dlss 4 and why it may cost more frames, why it is more detailed and how its able to trickle down to the older cards. digital foundries has a very good interview with bryan cantanzaro. he is vice president of applied deeplearning at nvidia. this fancy title basically means he oversees any and all ai and deep learning related things they have done. dlss, raytracing, framegen etc. he explains in everyday terms how everything works and what their philosophy is surround it all. it's a long video but its definitely worth a watch. it makes you much more appreciative of the work they do.

the new upscaler model in dlss 4.0 is heavier to run, but the graphical improvements are considerable, meaning the update is not to improve performance but to significantly improve the quality of upscaling, the frame generation component in dlss 4.0, on the other hand, is designed to improve performance, mainly by reducing vram usage by using a different technique for frame generation.

johnny was never captured by arasaka. when he encounters adam smasher in the building, smasher shoots him in half. spider, the netrunner on the crew, slotted a shard that had the soulkiller program on it into johnnys head before he took his dying breath. the visions we see of johnny being carted out of the building and interrogated are either memories that were planted in johnnys head, or they were completely fabricated by johnny himself in the 50 years he was trapped in mikoshi trying to make sense of how he could have possibly lost everything. johnny is a narcissist, and there's tons of examples of him embelishing events throughout the game. alt herself even tells you that you cant trust the things he tells you. johnny wanted to believe he was more important than he really was. he was convinced arasaka had taken alt to get to him when really they didn't give a shit about him. the vision of the tower raid doesn't include morgan blackhand because johnny wants to remember himself as the leader of the raid, and that it was his idea when in reality it was fully funded and supplied for by militech.

in phantom liberty 1. in the mission the damned if you side with netwatch and killed brigitte in cyberspace slider will recognize your actions. 2. in the mission no easy way out if you killed sasquatch an additional dialogue option unlocks when talking to angie. 3. also if you finished beat on the brat questline and beat the champion razor hugh you can mention it to aaron.

if you help brick escape in the pickup where you obtain the robot spider, he'll be peaceful when you find bes isis at the totentanz, and he will thank v for helping him. otherwise the encounter will be hostile.
613 diego ramirez performs a tpose attempting maximum intimidation and display of power.

dakota smith gives you a gig flying drugs where you have to shut down a jammer that's taking out her client's drones. if you drive around to where you can hack into one of the cameras, switch them until you get the one that's on the rooftop, facing the antenna's controls. you can us short circuit to fry the controls, completing the gig. dakota calls you, impressed that you came up with a solution that she'd never thought of. listening in to the npc's dialogue will sometimes reveal insights on them. for instance, when you go to meet mr. hands the first time, wait in the hallway and listen as he has a holocall conversation with his family. it's a side of him that you don't see otherwise. and when you leave reed and alex at the moth, they talk about what they've been up to, and how they haven't had any relationships. both of them acknowledge they're difficult people to love. and when gary the prophet tells you about a clandestine meeting where you'll see what the technonecromancers are doing, go to the location. johnny will ask your opinion take the last option and get a fun response out of him

if you perform the maxtac ambush before ghost town, you can surprise rogue by telling her hijacking hellmans convoy wont be the first time you attacked a convoy. shes impressed that you are the one who managed that ambush.
for 1150, if you do the mission life's work without being detected, they won't recognize you when you finish the shooting gallery.
if you attend the dlc party with all the people, before the mission down on the street and meet takas look alike you get hidden dialogue when meeting him at wakakos

not sure if it's common knowledge but something i noticed in the main pl quest you know my name where you break into the black sapphire. during the mission where you're at the sniper vantage point guiding reed to meet up with you, he will reach the middle where the elevator comes down to let soldiers out. if you're quick enough you can quickhack the elevator to continue going down and miss that floor. i did it with a netrunner build so i'm not sure if there are intelligence checks

only started cyberpunk a few months ago. since then i've spent 350 hours in night city, three runs, all achievements, and your channel is an absolutely brilliant resource for gameplay, story and worldbuilding. bravo!
so glad cdpr did not give up on this game.

my fave is still during regina's gig to get the laptop where you also have to get sandra's databank and you read the info on the laptop showing that the ripperdoc upstairs has been working with the scavs and the dialog options that brings up. i'm mad that they count his death as an arrestable offense after that dialog, but its nothing laying low inside the place won't fix. also interesting to note on that laptop is that one of his patients is the one that goes cyberpsycho on her sister in a santo gig that cap sends you to do.

one interaction most people don't know is possible although it might be bugged in the current version of the game, is that if you finish rivers quests before you meet woodman for the first time you can use your friendship with river to threaten woodman to get the information about evelyn. if it is still broken there's a tiny mod on nexus that fixes it. the problem is that when talking to woodman the game checks if you have certain variables aka quest facts and the one involving river is mislabeled. so technically the dialogue for woodman tries to see if you have a quest fact that doesn't exist, there's an almost identical onr thag you get when meeting river though, so it seems like cdpr accidentally left in a typo since it's such a rarely seen event

another sort of tangential thing regarding woodman and clouds, is if you do judy's side gig line, and got through all of clouds without killing anyone or going loud with anything, when you talk to the tyger claws lady who runs clouds i forget her name, the exgf of judy the you try and convince to help you take over clouds for the moxx, she tries to accuse v of being a blood thirsty killer, but you get a dialogue option where v points out that they went in, got the information they needed, and left, and nobody ended up in a body bag. to which the tc lady actually acknowledges that detail, and thanks v for not making it a blood bath. i don't know if you go loud with that mission, but do everything nonlethal if v has the same dialogue option, i always do that one quiet, but i do know for a fact if anyone you drop is done nonlethal, and you walk out without any alarms or open combat, you get the option. i can't ever bring myself to do that one loud, because if so i don't get the dialogue option with woodman that let's you protect the dolls from further external hacking risks, by giving woodman that software update info to protect the dolls. for me that's the only viable method of ending that conversation. because i'm at least making things slightly safer for the dolls, who have a dangerous life as it is. if i can remove at least one threat vector in their life, i consider that a win.

a cool little bit of world building happens at the end of phantom liberty if you got the behavioral system component in somewhat damaged. after you decode it, if instead of using it, you just keep it in your inventory and don't do anything with it, you'll get more text messages from the unknown number criticizing your hesitation, trying to figure out why you haven't used it, and trying to encourage you to make one of the items.

i'm playing the game in 3 different builds  netrunner, meathead and sneeky breaky. what i noticed is that the glorified quest with malestroms in allfoods is not as complex as people think, while there's tons of other quests equally or even more complex in the choices and variations. you really need to complete the game at least 3 times to witness everything it has to offer.

one of the more interesting things players can choose to do while playing as v is to intentionaly get as many npc's killed as possible. the total number of characters v can end is pretty large, most of them relating to side gigs, either by not intervening or because we make a wrong choice and sometimes v can kill them, themselves. there is a simple reason why night city's columbarium. depending on v's choices, that place will contain a very large number of names belonging to npc's v has interacted with. v can literaly fill a graveyard, wich is extremly disturbing, to say the least. this could be an intereating subject for a future video how many characters can get end up dead because of v?

if you either stealth the rescue act 1 opening mission or kill every single scav in the apartment, then the scavs you meet in the optional job gun music won't recognize you. however, if any were left alive and saw you, they will become hostile. you can then resolve the conflict again if you have a high enough body stat for intimidation. surprised this wasn't mentioned in the video, as it's one of the earliest points in the game you can make a lasting rpg choice, even though the effects of it don't show until after you meet panam and gain her trust.
