i've been playing this game since it launched on ps4, dealt with all the rough times, then i finally upgraded to the ps5 version. it's come a long way. the 2.0 update and phantom liberty just top it off for me. i get so immersed in this game, absolutely love it.

just finished phantom liberty and really enjoyed it. the gigs, side missions, and the story really had me just in it. the performances for this dlc are splendid and with all the new changes, gear, cyberware i am chrome'd up beast! really great to own if you have the game already, thanks for the great vid y'all!

i haven't bought the dlc, but the 2.0 update has made this game way more fun for me. the new movement options have taken the game to a totally different level. you can jump cancel dashes and conserve your momentum by bunny hopping, it makes the game super quick and crazy. i feel like a real cyberpsycho as i'm jumping around at 100mph with my katana, sometimes slowing time midair to rain bullets on my enemies, tons of fun!
they really knocked update 2.0 out of the park. the game is in a great state now and its beautiful. everyone should try it if they havent now. i got my copy for 12 brand new!
i still havent gotten over the physical world of this game. its unbelievable and im probably permanently obsessed with its aesthetics

i love the cyberpunk world. i finished the game and all of the side quests and wished for more. and not just more quests, but more life. i want to see more shops opened, more npc types, make the world as big as it is with the level of detail it deserves. i wish they continued to make more content for this game as i believe despite its rough start, could be one of those games you play for years like a gta5. im glad to hear they are making a sequel. im not sure why they need a sequel, since the cyberpunk world theyve already created is awesome, but im just happy to hear they arent dumping this ip all together. i hope they take everything theyve learned from cp2077 and make it better in every way this wild sci fi expects.

when i finally got my hands on the ps5 a few months back, i jumped right into cyberpunk. absolutely amazing game, and now with the 2.0 update, i'm sure it takes it that much further. if only it released in this state 3 years ago.... they would have gotten so many awards!!

i preordered the game and have played since the day it launched. i never had nearly the same negative experience as seemingly everyone else around me. there were a few glitches here and there but i never found it to be particularly bad. i know this was not the experience of most, but it was mine. anyways, ive been playing on and off since then and its been probably my favourite game in that time. this expansion has only made things considerably better and i am so happy!

i'm starting cyberpunk 2077 for the first time tomorrow and i'm so excited! i wanted to wait for the 2.0 update and phantom liberty to be released before i even got the game. i remember being so excited for this game and being disappointed when it was released but i'm glad that they didn't just give up on the game and kept on improving it!
it really should have more games with cyberpunk thematic. thats why i really like this game despite all of the bugs because it is one of the few games about this genre

cyberpunk 2077 has been my most installedreinstalled game, basically every time a major update came out i would hop back in. i even bought it on steam and got a month of geforcenow to try out the rt overdrive mode. but i never got sucked all the way back in enough to do a full replay. i think now is the right time to revisit.
029 two npcs tripping eachother xd

currently replaying the main game since the update and i'm genuinely enjoying it. i was a bit salty that my 100 hour character wasn't as op as it was before the update but the added challenge is actually refreshing.

building up v from scratch on my 4th5th full run of the game. i have been in love with the game despite the bugs from day 1. played on a ps4 slim my first playthrough, now on ps5. between my first to now, i have not been disappointed. seeing all the updates and improvements has me hopeful for the future of this game, and i look forward to how this plays out. i only am past getting johnny and am clearing the side quests first before any mains. level 33 at the moment. love the new trees and cybernetics systems!
im actually really excited to jump back into this. i did a full play through about two years ago but playing starfield has me yearning for another sci fi fps rpg experience

i can not wait! i loved it when it came out i have 146 hours in the game, i had almost no issues outside of two crashes and some clipping in the first two hours or so of the game, but still the issues other people were not ok by any means, i hope with everything now its even better, going to start a new game and go at it again.
i really loved this game, 3 months after launch on ps5. one of the more pleasant surprises i have had in gaming in a while. it has a lot of classic rpg pitfalls but a lot of classic rpg upside too.
update 2.0  phantom liberty got me hooked on cyberpunk 2077 more than ever. made me want to just completely restart and enjoy the world from scratch! what a comeback story.
the detailed world building and how every corner of every street feels different from every other and just littered with details, its incredibly impressive. ps5 graphics looks amazing too

plays like it always should have! definitely enough to revisit or explore this beautiful world for the first time! and idris elba is a nice inclusion and definitely adds that star power that plays along nicely with keanu reeves

played 2077 right from day one, and up until 2 months later, racking up 214 hrs and a 100 completion. love the game, love the world, love the quests. there were some minor glitches, but nothing really gamebreaking. heck, i only crashed like 6 or 7 times for the whole duration of playing. stoked to play the dlc, preordered it a week ago.

i played through earlier this year before 2.0, and even then it was a lot of fun. a very easy game to get fully obsessed with, especially if you like to collect everything. really excited to see how the new perk trees map out and get more time with good old johnny silverhand. only problem is that i went for 100 trophies and am kinda burned out on it right now, will give the dlc a play in a few months probably

i just finished my first run of pl, saw the first two endings i could get. 20 hours, still have some stuff to do in dogtown. i loved it. been playing since launch and these years, this wait, was totally worth it
great review as always. love your sincerity and care for non spoilers. you really are the 1 outlet for deciding on a game, at least for me.

i started playing when 1.2 came out, on pc, and i loved it ever since. never fell off of it, and i never had any majormild issues. a few really small glitches but nothing that pulls me off it. i have about 380 hours in with 5 playthroughs, but i have put some time into starfield before i put another 60 into this lol

as someone fortunate enough to have a 4090 and an i9 pc....cyberpunk with path tracing and everything cranked to ultra, 180 fps is the second most immersive game i have ever played, behind only rdr2, but is the single most visually stunning game i have ever seen...and my favorite game all time, which is crazy to me. sometimes ill unequip my weapons, press g to slowly walk around, and just fucking gawk. i understand the launch was unacceptable, but they delivered boys, it took some time, but it happened. if it launched at 2.0, it would have matched most of the hype. its not the rpg we were hyping it up to be, but its like a fallout game meets the best far cry game youve ever played. 700 hours in, will be playing this game on and off until orion.
already loved the game before 2.0 but now i love it even more, been enjoying the hell out of my new playthrough!

i really like a lot of the changes involving the cyberwear and skill trees. here's hoping the sequel in ue5 will look amazing and take everything a step farther, maybe incorporate more of the tabletop elements and things we didn't see in this game.
been playing all morning. started a new playthrough a couples weeks ago to lead up to the dlc release. loving it so far! story is amazing and gripping in dogtown
i picked it up on sale a year ago, and i completed the storyline. its such a good game now!

after never touching a purchase for 2077 noting its terrible launch, edgerunners was what brought me to make that leap of faith, and i actually loved my time with the game prior to 2.0. however, there were a lot of glaring issues still that stopped me from wanting to progress further. now, that i've waited long enough, i'm so excited to dive back in, especially with the phantom liberty dlc. plus, there's just something so good seeing the game embrace the combat improvements that make the game feel even more like an anime than it used to. if any of y'all haven't seen edgerunners, you should. one of the best pieces of art i've ever spent time on in a long while.

the phantom liberty premise really reminds me of escape from new york. the president is lost in the prison of nyc and snake plisken merc is tapped to go in and retrieve him.... not too shabby of a premise actually. iconic film.

i am very happy with where this game is at. i initially bought it on ps4 and gave up not too far in. i have been revisiting this after every major update and it still didn't hit. finally, after 2.0 and on a ps5 i am very happy. i have had no performance issues, no bugs, no noticeable texture pop ins. i am actually going to get phantom liberty because i want more!
i started a new save yesterday in preparation for the dlc. i have not touched the game since the beginning of 2021. with the 2.0, it feels like a lot better of a game. can't wait to explore the dlc.

i was level 21 on my first playthrough that i didn't finish. coming back 3 years later and wow! i forgot how action packed night city is. 2.0 and the other uodates throughout the years finally brought cdpr idea of cyberpunk to life.

i love cyberpunk and i love the new update. my only problem with the game is the roads feel empty and then when you're driving in the desert and see all the phantom cars a few hundred meters that aren't really there then just casually disappears is such a strange thing

its a brand new game i cant lie i used to talk bad about this game until i played it last month and wow i didnt realize i missed a masterpiece, now with 2.0 its even better i cant stop replaying this beautiful game cant wait for liberty for my 3rd replay
i played one mission in 2022 and put it down, i will reengage this fall. glad to hear the 2.0 and pl positive updates!
been playing for the first time since the 2.0 update launched  20 hrs in and i couldnt be happier with my decision to wait so far  even with the occasional visual glitch

i've been playing since day 1. i built my rig for the game and it eventually would release on my birthday weekend. i beat the game with each of the three paths. i'll play as another nomad and discover phantom liberty through the story. i hope everyone who plays has fun!
haven't played it yet, but pretty stoked to try it out now that 2.0 is out. looks like they've made substantial improvements since launch!
i played it during the next gen ps5 update and i never faced any glitches. it was amazing.

cyberpunk 2077 is looking really cool nowadays, and the developers should be commended for their efforts, but it's a really good example of why these days you might not want to buy games immediately on launch.

dogtown feels huge. it is so tight, so turned in on itself and stacked on top of itself that i don't know if i will ever fully grasp or explore the layout. the whole thing is so multileveled, from sewers and usually 2 or 3 levels above the street. it feels like if half of the rest of night city was condensed down into a single district with content over content and under content rather than just content islands scattered around the map like some of the other districts are.

this game is my favourite game of all time. also stella in the game is played by the sphere hunter in phantom liberty! shes also sasha's big sister from the let you down music video from edgerunners. also theres more edgerunners easter eggs in 2.0 in general! the perks has lil icons of the characters and go to the place where theres grave markers for a surprise

whatever cdpr does next i firmly believe a sequel should be it. they nailed the presentation, story, and lore, and now 2.0 brought the gameplay up to par. as long as they apply these changes to a sequel and actually deliver on an open world that isnt a beautiful tech demo, they have a real masterpiece just waiting to be made.

i have been playing this game since day one, of course the launch was very bumpy but this game turned out to be one of my favorite games for sure. i played through the campaign various times so i am definitely diving right in on this expansion.
i love this game so so much. ive stuck with it since a few months after it initially released. definitely one of my all time favs! never fade away!
i've waited 5 years to play it, because i already got burned in the past by preordering a game lol. waiting was sooooo worth it, one of my favorite games!!

been enjoying cyberpunk 2.0 more than starfield, shockingly. might just hit the spot for me better with the build crafting and gameplay, along with the gritty but fun world building that just manages to make you feel like you're living it and you don't feel bad playing your own way, which usually happens with a lot of rpgs. great byb as always!
stuck with this game since launch. only 2 true playthroughs but man i just fell in love with the world. excited to see the new clothes in the expansion!
judge me if you will, after a little over 2 years of being a beta tester, and paying total of 90 for this final release, i'm happy with this game.

great video as always, i have let starfield cool a bit and started a new play through over the weekend of cyberpunk.first time playing it on ps5, the dual sense triggers , game changer at least for me. the new 2.0 update really is fun, cops are hard to loose, perks are more substantial, overal great update. i personally can't wait for the dlc, looks great. as you can tell highly positive about this game, have liked it from the start, initially played it on the xbox series myself, one of my faves.
i was very impressed by the quality of the audio in this new update., it sounds very impressive and realistic.
i waited, and playing it now with phantom liberty. it is amazing
i guess i feel grateful and lucky to have enjoyed cyberpunk 2077 since day one. and now its even better. like yourselves, i kept returning to it often.
i played this on my ps4 on launch day and loved it even if it was a broken mess. started fresh with 2.0 and im hooked like its the first time again. cant wait to jump into the new dlc

my biggest annoyance that still isn't fixed and probably won't are freaking clones.. clones everywhere. moment i walked out of the appartement i had 5 clones kids walking by two min later triplets. freaking immersion breaking. and yes hdd mode is off and i am playing it from a nvme.
i been playing for about 900hrs, and it feels like a new experience. they put a lot of love into the update and can't wait until phantom liberty comes out.
cyberpunk 2077 is my favorite game of all time! this will be my 4th play through. im super excited for the dlc! ive been playing since launch. this game did a 180 in a amazing way!
i still remember when v gets to his apartment and lays sideways on his bed. the game's finally complete and it's bittersweet to see how the game has evolved
i started and finished cyberpunk 2077 last year. it's hands down one of my favorite games of all time. can't wait to jump into phantom liberty
still sad theres no 3rd person but im cautiously excited for phantom liberty

i've been with cyberpunk since patch 1.5, which was when i upgraded my pc it was the first game i bought after that. i haven't yet played phantom liberty, but i've been blown away by the 2.0 upgrade. everything is just so much smoother, and more logically designed. i say that as somebody who has loved the game since i initially played it. also, i had been concerned when the new system requirements were announced but, not only is the game even more beautiful, but it runs even better than it did beforeand i never had any previous issues, to be clear, certain other devs should take note.

i originally played it on my xbox one when it came out not only was it falling apart at the seams but the system just couldnt handle it. so i stopped playing it after only 10 hours in or so.i just started playing it again a couple weeks ago on my series x and im a little over 80 hours now lol. between the new system and all the updates its like night and day. its a new game. im glad i waited.
i finally finished cp2077 earlier this year. after 153 hours i have to admit, this was one of the best games i have played in recent years

its one hell of a game now, im glag i got it. i never used fast travel so i wouldnt miss just how much work has gone into this game, i also walked a lot and looked around, it may have had a bad start but now its fantastic.

something that i noticed right after the 2.0 update is how good the game looks, ive got an rtx 3050 and the game looked good but not strikingly good, update rolls around, i get to play with some settings and then boom. game looks like another reality, its actually a testament to how good our technology is with this game being probably the best looking game to have ever been released.

ive found cyberpunk to be like a fungoofy dinner with friends. it was a great time, i ate quite a bit. once dinner is about over and everyone is too full to continue eating, the waiter comes over with freshly made dessert. its looks amazing and from the people whove already tried it also say its amazing. fine cd projekt red ill eat my dessert and be sure ill enjoy it.
im definitely grabbing the expansion! thanks for the headsup. honestly, this has to be one of the best games ive ever playedits a masterpiece! 338
it may have taken 3 long years but the game is actually playable and really really fun! can't wait for the 26 th!

i played cyberpunk since launch, while ive seen many people leave it, i stood with it and watched the game grow and become more of a thing that everyone can enjoy. i am happy, i feel rewarded for loyalty and i am proud of what this game has came to be.
the ending credits song is as emotional as i really want to stay at your house from edge runners
i love the game but i do feel like as great as the update is and how far it's come since launch, the game we saw in those e3 trailers still doesn't exist and i wish we got that game

i played the game on launch and found it amazing, never crashed, no bugs or anything for me. did one playtrough back then and then another when 1.5 dropped and just started another one with 2.0. i just finished the voodo boys part 30min before the supposed launch and am ready to start playing the expac

i preordered cyberpunk for ps4 back in 2020 and i played through the whole game, and honestly i loved it. i had almost no graphical issues on a ps4 slim, only had a few bugs here and there. some bugs stopped me from playing a questline, but honestly its not any more then a bethesda game at launch. i never got why people were so furious about it. i remember players bugging cd projekt red to release the game even if it wasnt finished and then getting mad that they didnt get a finished game. but for me it played great and im excited to play it again on a newer console with all these updates

honestly the biggest thing i get from cyberpunk is seeing the cool direction cd project red is going with games. i like the future setting and design they have in cyberpunk, i can't wait to see what they have planned in the future as far as fresh new games go.

i bought cp2077 on day 1, and finished in a month. then i spent another year exploring night city and the 5 endings. i have been starved for more cp2077 content and phantom liberty does not disappoint.

i have done probably 5 replays since this game came out. i really liked it. when it launched i had a brand new baby and it got me through the long sleepless night. i will definitely be getting this and doing another replay!
i can't wait to play been debating if i should start over since all the new updates make it feel like a different game
really have come to love this game despite its rough start. no other game seems to get me so immersed. rdr2, fallout 4 and new vegas are up there.

i played it at launch and got back into it recently, and have played it on the hardest difficulty both times and i am happy that they added more struggles to overcome, like having the game progress with you instead of saving up for an expensive piece of cyberwhere and blowing through the game. i would love to see an option to experience cyberpyphosis, like the more you go over the limit the more likely you will just randomly die. i also like how you actually want to buy more of the cars, originally i just got quest line cars and called it good, but with the el capitan missions you really want, and can collect all of the cars

i loved this game and was one of the freaks that played it day one on stadia... it worked well there. after losing my original finished stadia save i started a ps5 replay after the next gen launch and another now on 2.0. i am loving all the improvements. it feels like a totally new game.
one of my all time games as is, beyond excited for this. cyberpunk forever.
with phantom liberty and the 2.0 update i think this is one of my favorite games of all time. its incredible.

hoping this replaces the feeling of disappointment starfield brought me. the game wasn't the issue.. the forced moral compass was. that and i thought they would add cool body mods like fallout new vegas

can't say i'm completely a fan of how they handled the skill trees, but i absolutely love everything else. i just preferred the freedom of being able to get whichever perk i wanted without having to purchase linked skills or needing each branch at a specific level to do so. regardless, i am on my third playthrough and am honestly having a blast.
i love how these videos pop up in my feed after i buy whatever the video is talking about. i just bought this dlc an hour ago.
so glad they didnt let the hate get to there heads and they could finish this awesome game

always love the balanced takes from jake as always to tell it how it is. that being said having played cyberpunk for the first time earlier this year was a blast for me even with some very obvious glitches still happening. this universe is great and i just hope cdpr gives it the respect it deserves next time if they make another game in it. i appreciate they didnt just drop the ip and continued to expand on it. also the anime is op.

i preordered for ps4 years ago. like 2018 after the gameplay release. i dont think i can forgive how much bs was fed to us. if you like the game now, more power to you. im just pissed that so many people have forgotten the past.
tbh the players that had the from week 1 shouldn't have to pay for this dlc.
always loved cyberpunk even when it was broken in half it was hilarious. it was one of the most immersive experiences ive ever had
literally the only review i trust

you're a bit caught up in pre 2.0 nostalgia. talking a lot about it though it doesn't have a lot of relevance anymore. best post 2.0 katana by far right against hordes of enemies that pairs well with sandevistan is byakko. higher attack speed than cyclonemodded s noniconic katana, although the attack speed buff is not permanent and instead only lasts for a few seconds after killing someone. so start combat against the weakest of the enemy group. in bossfights without adds this weapon actually is a bit on the weaker side so you might want to carry a second katana for those encounters. the errata is actually a very strong option  if you play with incendiary nades instead of the launcher arms. it would pair even better with a contagion  overheat raven microcyber build than with throwing knifes and sandy though. in that setup errata jumps to the top. but then the build is of course not a sandykatana build anymore but primarily a contagion explosion build with the errata being one of many tools in the pocket to make enemies go boom or give them the rest if they survive the boom. when going for berserker instead of sandevistan some people want that the gwynbleidd sword becomes a very strong option, assuming you actually take enough damage to stay at below 25 health to benefit from the effect. works best with militech berserk if you activate it at below 20 and don't use itemsperks that heal you. the 25 effects are still active with the other berserks but as soon as you regenerate a single point of hp you lose them. make sure that you combine this with other implants and perks that activate at or below 25 health and explicitly not something like healonkill, that would be counterproductive. though byakko might actually still be a bit better against hordes in this setup but not by much as in the sandy build. gwynbleidd will decimate bosses though  the extra 25 damage also applies agains minibosses like maxtac elites. requires that you own witcher 3 on the same platform and account to get it. jinchumaru is a very decent, high damage option if you go for optical camo. doesn't have the attack speed of byakko or effects of errata or gwynbleidd but the higher crit damage makes up for it. you can even get crit chance very high outside of optical camo  the higher your crit chance from all sources is the more competitive this sword becomes. but it probably still never outclasses the byakko against hordes but it will outclass it in bossfights, especially if you can use optical camo mid fight. best throwing weapon by far is the agaou, especially with the skill tree for throwables filled out. iconic electric axe with highest damage per throw. it would have one of the highest damage per throw values even without the shock effect but that is icing on the cake, especially against mechsrobots. when going for headshots or breaking the weakpoints that's even more alpha strike damage. found in an organized crime activity in dogtown requires phantom liberty.

i don't think this is even close to being the best sandy build don't see you murking the entire maxtac squad the moment they land on the groud with just one sandy charge on very hard and i'm reluctant to say that an optimized sandy build is the best. optimized sandy build is easier to play against ncpd and maxtac but optimized netrunner is better for single target battles like boss fights etc... the first mistake of this build is not enough cyberware capacity. even my netrunner build at level 60 has 302 points without having maxed out tech  and therefore the edgerunner perk. remember to pick up everything so you don't miss a shard  practically impossible, but choose to start a playthrough from phantom liberty minimize the risk of missing. secondly, you don't use the perk in the tech skill tree that allow you to choose bonus stats every time a piece of cyberware is upgraded. rerolling every piece of cyberware till you get the bonus melee damage  usually from 1.9 to 5  to have a combined 40 to 50  melee damage bonus. some other mistakes would be not raising your shinobi skill to at least 55 so low stamina doesn't affect your melee attack speed in sandy time and not using cockatrice eyes and that hand cyberware to achieve 100 crit chance. last objective flaw of this build is not mastering the use of a 5 katana with two tier 5 cyclone mods that allow it to function as an activated byakko, the only prerequisite being having to trigger it through a running attack. learn it so you can muda muda adam smasher, oda and every single boss in this game without relying on killing something, a fatal flaw that make byakko useless in most boss fights. my final critique would be that almost every sandy enjoyer who makes it their habit to lay waste to the ncpd, militech and maxtac in the badland  badland has the strongest law enforcement in the game, with 13 of the enemies having a red skull symbol over their head. anny build testing needs to be tested in front of the sunset motel so you can see their limits  can tell you the best sandy to wipe out endless maxtac waves on very hard is the falcon. with it maxed out 14 seconds charge  with perks of course you just have more time to kill more enemies, not to mention the melee crit damage it provides. although i undestand if some of you use apogee for cosplay reason, it's worth to remember that apogee cost 14 more capacity points to install.

this is not the most broken. netrunning build using almost exclusively synapse burnout i know is very boring is the strongest. katana build is the second, but the gap between them is pretty steep. melee and netrunning builds are the only builds which can conformably kill maxtac at the hardest difficulty. katana's are the strongest of the melee weapons, byakko being the strongest of them all like you mentioned. the main issue with melee builds is that you do not have as much reach compared to netrunning. i have tested minmaxed katana builds extensively and i often die at some point by a sniper shot. you can also get bursted down easily by turretsmechs. i test builds in the big camp near the golden pacific travel point and usually spawn in maxtac as well. another downside is that you will run out of time with berserksandi uptime, which make you quiet vulnerable. netrunners in comparison can stay in overclock indefinitely with synapse burnout massive 3 seconds extension on kill. also berserk is stronger compared to sandi. both sandi and berserk basically make you invulnerable, but berserk has a longer uptime. especially if you use the zetatech berskerk, which has a 11 second duration with only a 25 seconds cooldown. another notable improvement would be to use countershell cyberware. it is one of the most op pieces of cybereware in the game. it helps a lot with preventing burst damage for a low cyber capacity cost. next second heart is a big trap of a cyberware piece. it has a very long cooldown activation and costs a lot of cyber capacity. you should use bioconductor and healonkill instead. with that extra capacity you can get the cockatrice optics, which will significantly increase your dps. at last the perk edgerunner is also a trap. the health loss is never worth the extra cyber capacity. health is one of the most important stats for survivability. you have enough cyber capacity to get all the important pieces of cyberware for any build without using edgerunner.

dont sell ur guns!!!! break them down for parts. after 2.0 the best way to upgrade ur guns and chrome is to get as many components as u can. only sell the common and uncommon guns that are worth more than like 700ish which will be later on in the game when the gun prices scale to ur level, regardless of the weapons rarity they can be worth a lot. always break the purple and gold guns for epic and legendary components. i know it seems counter intuitive but since the update, this is how the economy works. besides all u should be using are the iconic weapons which u can only upgrade and not destroy

post2.0 attributes can be reset, once. the main reason you break down weapons is for the components to either build new ones, upgrade iconics, or upgrade cyberware. you only spend eddies on building iconics, like buzzsaw or comrade's hammer. you can easily upgrade your weapons by keeping the best from what you loot. until you are level 10, selling guns lets you pay off vik and makes up for the lousy payouts you get for gigs early. past 10, stop selling them, keep them for upgrading iconics and cyberware. you're going to be making enough from gigs and looting eddies from bodies and safes, and since you can't buy components anymore it's an easy way to stock up. the sidequests are not just there for filler. they're ways to gain xp and eddies, iconic weapons and cyberware, and your choices in them can effect your endgame choices.

you need item components to upgrade your cyberware. you need eddies to buy cyberware and things from merchants. typical below tier 2 arms you 'find' sell for about 600  800 eddies and break down to 5 tier 1 item component, but if you need ics, no amount of money allows you to purchase them... directly. but.... if you want to play absolutely vanilla, you do this. buy slaughtomatic guns from vending machines. there are 3 next to each other right in front of the ripperdoc's office near the goldsmith street fast travel box. there are two in the atrium level of megabuilding 10. leaving mb10 turn left and walk to the parking garage, turn right, walk up the street, crossing the first street coming from the left, then turn left on the side walk and find two more vending machines. in kabuki in the market circle where the gun and the netrunner dealers are, on the lower level, where the gun dealer is, if you walk around the entire circle, there are 4 or 5 vending machines. those are the ones i know by heart. there are many more. as i stated before, arms you 'find' break down to 5 tier 1 ic, but sell for 600  800 eddies. buying slaughtomatic guns cost 100 eddie each and breaks down to 5 tier 1 ic. that means, the pistol you can break down to 5 tier 1 ic, if you sell itanywhere you sell gives you the exact same price, even drop pointsyou get let's say 650 eddies, which you can use to buy 6 12 slaughtomatic guns, which you can break down to 6 12 tier 1 ics, which is 1 12 more than if you break them down directly, but you have to work for it. or you can do it the easy way, but people are going to start screaming and pulling their hair out, and crying that it is cheating... use console commands to trade your eddies and ics without going through the rigmarole. sell all the stuff you don't want wherever you want. for every 100 eddies you can buy 1 tier 1 ic. for 5 tier 1 ics you can craft 1 tier 2 ic. for 5 tier 2 ics you can craft 1 tier 3 ic. and so on. just do the math. use console commands to remove the money you 'spend' for ics and give yourself the equivalent in ics. the vending machines will sell about 25 guns if they haven't been used in a long time, but far fewer if they have been used within at least the last 24 hours game time.the only difference is in not running to every slaughtomatic vending machine all over the map, standing there and buying gun after gun, until the vending machine runs out, to buy the guns for breaking down. so you can do a lot of running around to get guns to break down to get the ics you need, all completely fair and within what the game allows, or you can simulate doing the grinding by using console commands. if you think you should have to sit there and click, and wait....... click, and wait....... click, and wait....... to buy guns you then just break down, you are a sick puppy  go find a doctor. that's not the kind of game i want to play. you do you, but leave me out of it. starting with tier 2 weapons, the ics you get greatly exceed the eddies you get for selling them. for example 1 tier 2 gun breaks down to 5 tier 2 ic  25 tier 1 ic  2500 eddies, but sells for only about 1100  1200 eddies. so above tier 2 weapons, it is better to break them down for ics. always check and do the math.

breaking down weapons for parts is okay if you have saved enough eddies, especially toward the middle of your playthrough. if you take the time to do all the side quests and complete the ncpd scanner hustles, you'll earn more eddies than you need. getting parts for upgrading your cyberware or getting your favorite iconic weapons to tier 5 requires components you can only get sparingly in random drops or breaking down unneeded weapons. trust me, you'll get more weapon drops than upgrade components in this game.

in the latest cyberpunk version, breaking equipment for components is basically the only correct choice. gigs give more than enough scratch, and you need a ton of components to upgrade your chrome. if you buy new chrome every time a new tier unlocks  you won't have any extras with or without extra scratch from selling guns, because chrome of high tier is all expensive af. much better to buy it as you play, and then just upgrade

the components from guns helps, but here's how i do it. i don't break down guns until i start finding tier 3 guns and when i start finding that i start selling all of my tier 1 guns and breaking down the 2s and 3s. then once i start finding tier 5s i sell the tier 1s, 2s, and 3s, and breaking down everything higher that i don't need. if you do this you will have tons of money and plenty components for upgrading your iconic weapons and cyberware.

really one of the most painful things to me is to see how unrecognized and under appreciated this game still is. my friends still laugh at me when i tell them cyberpunk is my favorite game of all time and many of them still have never picked it up despite me nearly begging due to the shaky release and bad press the game got surrounding it's release. these love letters to cyberpunk mean so much to me, they put in to words what a lot of us can't how brutal and cruel the world is but yet at the same time full of love and hope if you dig deep. the characters are unparalleled and the graphics and setting just can't be beat, thanks for this choom much love to all of you out there!

i will never, ever forget the conversations with kerry eurodyne on the rooftop  the conversation after the concert. they don't say it outright, but i'm pretty sure v saves kerry from trying to take his own life again that night you show up in his mansion. he had dismissed all of his staff for the night, was showering with a gun. and after the concert, he basically says it without saying it. he hints heavily that if v hadn't shown up that day, it stopped him from doing something drastic. when kerry felt alone, v came along and let him relive his glory days a bit with his longgone friend, and gain a new friend in the meantime through v. i love kerry so much lol

i am absolutely obsessed with the cyberpunk world. cyberpunk 2077 is the best game i've ever played and edgerunners is top 1 on my anime list. i just can't stop thinking about this universe

i've logged over 3500 hours in this game. first playthrough ruined me. that was a bit under a year after the game originally launched i had an old pc that was on its last legs when the game came out so i got a mate to build me a cyberpunk read one in 2021. i'm an old, first gen female gamer  in the second half of my fifties with the declining hormone levels to match. i thought i had become, not exactly dead inside, but emotionally muted you really don't realise how much those hormones influence your emotions until they go away. and that first playthrough actually made me realise that i could still feel, because it made me so bloody sad in a way i hadn't been for ages. i'm terrible for repeat plays  i can spend months and months playing and replaying games to try different paths, different builds, etc, and so it was with this. subsequent playthroughs didn't make me feel in the way the first did, but i began to relax and enjoy the gameplay more. i did take a side trip into rdr2 itself a wild emotional ride for a few months while i was waiting on phantom liberty but the dlc lured me right back in and is even better than the main game.

im 25 and i used to play video games day and night as a kid but moved on from them in my adulthood. i had an injury at work in the spring and had the next 2 months of summer to recover and basically do nothing. i decided to give cyberpunk a try after i bought my fancy new ps5 and 4k 165hz monitor and a great set of headphones and oh my god. i spent literally 2 straight months playing this game and exploring the world pretty much all day every day and just basically lived another lifereality, inside of a video game. it was completely enveloping because of how realistic it is, but also so emotional because the story is so well written and how your choices effect everything, you really feel like you are living a life inside this game and making relationships with real people its insane. falling in love with panam, grieving jackie, getting to know a brother in johnny silverhand. ive never in my life played a game so realistic to what real life is. not only is it the most realistic game ive ever played in terms of the senses, the graphics, environment, ambience, etc. but its so realistic in terms of the emotions it evokes and how close it is to real life emotions and relationships. id give anything to play this game for the first time again.

i'm 49 years old and have been playing video games for as long as i can remember. i bought cyberpunk 1 week ago, a little scared because of all the hate the game had received in the past. it has become one of my top 3 favorite games of all time. and it's on its way to becoming my 1 favorite game. it's absolutely amazing. thanks for your video and for showing people what cyberpunk is really like today.

you know what i noticed on release, and even kinda now? most people who enjoy cyberpunk 2077 weren't gamers per se, those whom enjoy the gameplay first, but more of a film, books, and etc. lovers, whom may have overlooked bugs and flaws of this game, and were in awe from atmosphere and story that was on release. no other game had dragged me in so much, that 3.5 years after it's release, i still think so highly of this game, and still ocassionallly return to it once every 6 months to complete it, as soon as the memories of details fade away a bit
that aldecado campfire with panam was truly quite magical, i was there in that moment and all those characters felt so real, wasnt ready to be blown away by this game

i grew up in la, cyberpunk feels like home to me. everyday i see inspirations and scary parallels. i was best friends with a jackie welles in high school, and had a fling with a judy. night city will always feel like home

thank you for making this, choom. im glad that im not the only one who still to this day is moved by the whole cyberpunk universe, from the base game to the dlc to edgerunners, its become a massive part of my life for many reasons, but i think this is one of those things in life which will stay with me forever. great video, earned a new subscriber.

i have 700 hours in cyberpunk. i first completed it within the first 3 release weeks and find myself starting another playthrough again and again. i honestly don't really know why. maybe it's some sort of nostalgia, i want to experience the game for the first time again. i want to immerse myself in night city, get to know all the characters, feel the dread, experience the vast interconnected worldbuilding and the hidden depths behind every corner of this huge game. of course it never ends up feeling the same. its never as mindblowing and captivating as the first time, yet i still love night city and find myself longing to wander its streets. i don't know how often i replayed the main storyline, i 100ed the game like 3 times, and i have done each and every ending over and over again. i just cant comprehend how they were able to create such a huge variety mindblowing storylines, intrigues and mysteries all interconnected, coexisting symbiotically in this beautiful hellscape that is night city.

i absolutely love the world of cyberpunk. i put 100 hours on my first playthrough. i did all the gigs, all the police reports, all the side missions i could do, phantom liberty, driving around the city listening to bangers from body heat radio, optimizing my build, and much more. im so glad i played the game this year instead of when it came out. i feel bad for those who had to deal with the game on release, but you haven't played cyberpunk yet i 100000 recommend it now. anything cyberpunk sign me up. i can't wait for cyberpunk orion!
300 hrs in zero regrets. i love this game dearly and i really love cyberpunk. lol even wrote a fanfic

as a fan of blade runner, i can't get enough of cyberpunk 2077. futuristic worlds are my favorite and every since the game came out, i've been obsessed with it as well. the characters, vehicles, and locations are just awesome

after nearly 3000 hours in this game, and still playing, i know exactly what you mean. i would have assumed i'd have put this game down after maybe 300500 hours like my other favorites, but there's something about this game that just pulls you in and never lets go.

i have been obsessed with skyrim for the longest time, literally feeling homesick for an imaginary world. i recently started playing cyberpunk after my partner kept saying how good it was, and i can truthfully say that cyberpunk and skyrim fall into that same category of a cruel world that is so beautiful you want to be in it.

dude ive been so obsessed with this game for so long. im obsessed and havent been this obsessed with a game in a while. its so nice to know there are other people who are also as into it as me. feels so affirming . so so grateful this games launch didnt deter everyone, this game has so much promise and is so beautiful . shame so many people wrote it off so fast, grateful for all you chooms that also got caught up in the craziness and beauty that is cyberpunk

genuinly, first off we have the same taste in games which i love  but the reason i'm commenting is that i've also been depressed for years, but one of the credits sequences in cyberpunk is one of my main barriers against zeroing myself, to use the game's slang  the sheer amount and weight of emotion when judy asks you if you ever thought about what happens to everyone else, and how she breaks down when she can't leave you a message because she knows you'll never answer, it just floored me. that and most everyone else being a different stages of grief, viktor angrily snaps at how he wishes he could, no even should have done more his words, not mine  even panam, with the most violent and angry message out of them all, to me at least, seems to be angry not only that she did so much for you, but it still wasn't enough, and you weren't thinking about anything at all, because if you were, you'd have asked for help from a reliable source. to quote the name of a video essay i adore about cyberpunk 2077  night city hates you, and you have to deal with that, but as is said in the video, you can love living in a city that hates you, not just because you're an outsider who faces no consequence in a city created by artists, but also because within that hate that surrounds you at all times, you can find myriad little holes carved out of the world for people  families, crews, lovers, friends, brothers, and hell even good colleagues see v and their fixers the reason we love night city so much isn't down to the disgust of capitalism that writhes within it, but that even 53 years from now, when we'll be closer to saul or viktor's age, love and hope persist

this game really gave me much, shortly after my dad passed away this game came out, i had a hard time reconnecting with friends, family and social life in general. i was quite young and this game taught me to move on and made me remember to always cherish the moments we had. now few years after i am at a much better point of my live. partially thanks to cyberpunk that broke my shell again. thank you for reading my rant.
ive never played this game but i am obsessed watching the gameplays and reviews on yt. i love this type of aesthetic so much. it literally my dream.

honestly cyberpunk 2077 and red dead redemption 2 are the only games that i would personally consider perfect. they truly left me broken and wanting for more. im obsessed with both of them. the worlds, the characters, the stories, the lore everything is perfect.

thank you for expressing exactly how this game makes me feel. i have over 600 hours in this game, countless playthrough, and everytime the game still manages to entrance me and capture me. i tried many other games but none can satisfy me the same way cp77 did. on my first play of pl i sent so mi to the moon and i cried like a baby, looking at my screen, and that moment will stick with me forever. that's moment like these that makes an epic game for me.

this game's story made me cry. there's something about trying your absolute hardest to be something and have it all just to be swept under the rug or simply forgotten that destroyed me. that helplessness was gutwrenching. how many v's are there in nc? we were special until we weren't

thanks for this, man. i needed to watch your video today. i've dealt with depression and anxiety my whole adult life. it's been pretty much under control for some years now. but this past month, it's been really tough, as i been dealing with a really bad break up with an exgirlfriend and my dad going through an unexpected chemo. so depression has been on my radar for sometime now, and i've been fighting like hell to not let it settle in again. so, it's new year's eve and i've found your video... it has the message i didn't now i needed! yes, it's about a game i really love as well, for the same reasons as well. but you nailed in the end with the message it's all about escapism and how we use games to indulge our minds. from the bottom of my heart, thank you! you really helped me today.

cyberpunk is like no other game to me. im absolutely obsessed. on the end of my 3rd play through rn and still absolutely loving it so much. ill never get over how much of an impact this game had on me.

what a love letter man. i played it on release on pc and even though there were some bugs it was the most immersive game i've played ever. i truly felt like i lived a life with these characters. i still remember escaping the boundaries of night city's outskirts with panam looking at the stars. it gave me such a euphoric, freeing but sad feeling of what awaited even though that's where it ended. i realized that's literally what v was probably feeling too.

your final message with hardest to be in the background goes so hard dude

agreed with many points, which is very much why your title called to me. but i would be remiss without calling out... no love for kerry? out of all the amazing character moments one that is my favorite is sitting on the boat with kerry while he just strums those few chords and hums. i realized how much that impacted me because this game is loud, brutal, fast, and wild and it feels great, and that quiet peaceful moment hearing not a song but just a simple tune brings it all into stark contrast with the rest of night city and makes those amazing touching, emotional and beautiful moments shine all the brighter because of it.

i'm too can't seem to stop thinking about cyberpunk. this game somehow just keeps me coming back time and time again. characters are definitely the best part of the game and especially pl. i cried and laughed so many times on the first play through it's kinda crazy. that was a great video man, thank you so much. i'm literally in tears writing this comment after watching the video  you did a great job!

what a beautiful video this is, a true love letter. sharing your emotions and about your depression, i can relate so much to this, i was close often in my life to end it all but decided to push through it. you had me crying instantly talking about jackie and seeing panam, hearing the pl song had me in absolut tears. i never was as emotional as playing cyberpunk 2077, it's the best story game for me. i'm on my way to get my diagnose for adhd and autism, i'm 37 years old and just started to live my life. if you struggle and you read this please don't stop fighting.

i get you. i played old version many times with all it's flaws. night city is the best built city in any video game. seriously it makes other developers look like they are not even trying. the city just feels alive. when i play i never go from point a to point b. i explore, parkour and sometimes just stand and look around for minutes. when you go to city center and corpo plaza the absolute size and marvel of the city hits you hard. makes los santos laughable. you can honestly look at city as it's own character.

the phantom liberty theme played through the end credits is now one of my favourite pieces of music. also, that end credit sequence had a very james bond movie vibe to it. a very intelligent and thoughtful essay, choom. i could hear the passion, love and sensitivity in your voice. i'm in my early sixties as a kid, there was no cyberpunk, just sf  f. even personal computers were a thing of fiction, let alone that the new pc sitting on my desk is probably more powerful than a super computer of the 1970's was. thankfully, i've never dealt with depression or other mental health issues. i once described myself as chronically well adjusted and generally content, if now downright happy. oddly, i think my real life almost nomadic childhood had something to do with that. moving so often, i became very good at adapting and letting go of what was left behind. a brief stint in the canadian armed forces equipped me with endurance and selfdiscipline. that service is also what lead to my deepest connection with v. of course, i have tried all possible endings in both the base game and expansion. the one that hit me hardest was when you take the cure from the nusa and find yourself unable to use cyberware, becoming just a face in the crowd. as a very young soldier i'm talking 17 to 18 years of age i was capable of doing things my nonmilitary friends weren't. it sometimes made me feel more than human. but over the years my spine curved and gradually became worse. it continues to get worse every year. it has taken away a lot of my physical ability. so like v after being cured, i find myself remembering what it was like to be so damn good, but now i've lost it all and i'm just another face in the crowd. but i persist i have endurance, i am stubborn and for crying out loud, there's just one more thing i need to do in one game or another before i go! lol keep up the good work. you've got a good head on your shoulders. if your videos cast a new ray of light and hope into even one person's life, then you've done the world a good turn.

platted the game just yesterday after starting over with the 2.0 update . had the game since launch and experienced so few issues, even on my old ass ps4. throughout all of the controversy, i've sung the praises of cyberpunk and cdpr, and phantom liberty and the experience of platinuming the game really cemented the game as one of my favourites of all time. this video expressed everything i've been feeling about the game recently. great job dude!

love this take on cyberpunk. i knew it was special when i started playing it the day it came out, even with the shaky launch. its absolutely one of the greatest games ever made. phantom liberty absolutely knocked my socks off and felt like a whole new game in and of itself. its extremely rare for a game like this to come around i think, and im thrilled to have both been able to experience it and to continue to experience it in more playthroughs.

this was my first aaa video game, not counting myst, old atari st games, or pong! so imagine my shock  awe when i discovered cyberpunk 2077 last december on yt. having worked in blender 3d, i was impressed with the realism. but as a mac user, i thought i could never play this game... until i discovered crossover, which allows me to play on my mac m2 in 4k native with no upscaling, which blew my mind! i even got dlss working and archive mods. i completed several endings, cried deeply, and then continued until all quests  gigs were completed. i was still not done and went to night city daily. i now have over 1000 hours and continue to explore. i can't get enough! the music got me, the visuals are amazing, the writing is rich, and the cyberpunk fashion is so cool. ive never experienced anything like this and its changed my life. i dont think ill ever be over this, not until they release orion. i now paint my nails like valerie, i bought a cyberpunk sweatshirt, night city keychain, cyberpunk credit card skins, an official cyberpunk led sign, and bumper stickers! my music tastes have changed due to the game, too! it makes me see precursors to 2077 all around today, such as homelessness, urban decay, neuorolink, robotic arms, corporate behavior, guns, and violence the game is so thoughtprovoking. and they spent 437 million to date  totally awesome! i will never be the same and still cannot stop exploring and experiencing night city! hello, my name is wendy and im a cyberpunk addict!

i've always loved the cyberpunkvaporwavesynth wave aesthetic, so that's what ultimately made me want to buy this game. i waited until the 2.0 update, and even though it took me a while to really get going i don't normally play open world games, but again, the aesthetic intrigued me, i finally got into the game during holiday break. maaaan i'm addicted! the story, the side quests, the looting, the cyberware and net running, the characters, the slang, and just the experience makes me feel like i'm in a totally in a new world. i found myself playing the game literally all day into the late night during holiday break. i'm still on side gigsquests right now, and still have yet to play the dlc, but i have a feeling i'll be playing this game off and on for a very long time.
ff7 was my favourite game of all time from 1997 till cyberpunk came out. its just an amazing game and an amazing world to be in. i love just walking around the city.

i love it the same way and i was delighted that you transitioned between quiet moments and most complicated characters with a clip of that conversation with reed. probably my favourite scene in any game, ever. pl's main cast is phenomenal. i love how alex and reed make v feel like a naive newbie, despite her legendary exploits outside of dogtown. that look alex gave me when i said sure, who doesn't love playing dressup and she just goes .... preem.

this franchise, this game and it's accompanying netflix anime, surprised me the most because of its character and world writing. never have i opened up an open world game before and became so attached, so enamored by the people and the locations i've been. closest is mass effect, but even that felt like deep down, i know it's a game here in night city, i really can let my mind run wild and think these are my friends, and these are our struggles and i love every moment of it. i'll never ever forget you johnny, panama, judy, jackie. fml i'm getting teary eyed again.

totally agree, cyberpunkk 2077 has been a game that has marked me in my life. this game came at a key moment in my personal development my time as a student was coming to an end and i had to face my independence as an adult in a new city far from my family and friends. and this game accompanied me on this hard road of growing up, it helped me when i started to feel lonely, when i failed in my first job, when i didn't know where my place was and it taught me that you have to enjoy the small moments with the people you care about and to take care of them. it also taught me that ambition, in many cases, is an empty dream that does not bring happiness. for all this and more, thank you v and night city.

i myself have several save files on cyberpunk. edgerunners was the reason i decided to play the game and boy did i play it. i remember doing 3 different play throughs back to back after phantom liberty and having to physically stop myself from starting another one. i made myself stop playing for almost a year until just recently, and once i stepped back into this elaborate and imaginative world i still loved every second of it. the characters, the lore, the combat, despite its hardships in development ive loved from the beginning. theres just something i cant describe about getting fully immersed in night city, it never gets old. this truly is a special franchise with so much potential

this games been on my mind since the e3 announcement, it got even more so when i got to finally play it, it was a game that released in a horrific year for me but i thought whatever happens, ive got that to look forward to, it gave me peace after a long year and im forever grateful for it. moments like the skye clouds conversation are where i truly fell in love, i had to shake myself because i was so immersed in the scene and i didn't want it to end, and i remember being in awe during pieces, what a quest that is, all 4 of the character questlines were also a huge highlight for me, especially judy's and panam's, this game took over my life so much that i started getting into the tabletop lore and the beauty of it is, the more you know, the deeper this game's story becomes.

i also love how a sort of end times we might of imagined for our future is so subtilely but hugely playing a part in the whole theme. theres so many references to a sort of prophetic biblical end times its crazy, down to hearing homeless people that probably cant afford cyberware talk about the mark of the beast to seeing a preacher on a tv talk show struggle with the morality of cyberware, to even being attacked by drugged out hobos going on about mark of the beast and the devil and all that. cyberpunk is such a trip at every angle man.

the story it conveyed in only 10 episodes is something you cant forget.
what i love is that they use music and locations from the game and it all works together so well.

agreed 100. also the art style is just amazing. the lights, atmosphere, popping colors and the way everything is directed and timed with the music and sounds it is such an incredibly immersive anime. also i love the way they talk and have their own dialect related to the world they live in. i think when it comes to speech in world building there isn't any anime or manga out there that does this better. it is just one of the most polished animes of all time, there are so many details i could go on about.

i definitely agree with the idea that the music helps immerse you into the story. especially in the third episode when friday night fire fight, and the last episode when i really want to stay at your house starts playing. im kind of a music guy, so that kept me hooked to the show.
this show not only demonstrates an amazing clash between hopelessness and possibility. it also does an amazing job showing how no matter how david felt, he accomplished nothing of impact
i fully agree with the music, going into a random shop then hearing that i really want to stay at your house hits different
everything you mentioned and more. the characters were all awesome, but becca was impressively brilliant and the one that really made it for me. it was her ending that was beyond hearbreaking.
as lucys and david relation ship progress and in the scenes where they kiss u can see the moon surround them more and more
it didn't over stay it's welcome. telling the story it wanted to tell without bloating
not only is edgerunners a great anime its a good tie in really goes to show how good a character night city itself really is
i just really fell in love with night cityyyyyy like immediately
how realistic the gangs are and the corps that they are to irl
the thing i love about edgerunners is the way that it made the city alive, and in turn made it easier to play an rpg like a roleplaying game

the theme is also different from any other show that i can think of, its like its futuristic but not what your used to, it tells the story from all angles the good the bad and the ugly, from poverty to crime to success and it resonates so well with the real world even though its based in a different time period, most of the other futuristic shows dont tell the stories of the guys who grew up in these harsh conditions but cyberpunk does and we get to see why davids willing to do anything to get the people he loves out of it and thats why the chain of events hit so hard because we can understand what they are all fighting for
the music and vibes makes me wanna cry, cyberpunk is so great
this show was absolutely amazing and i cant wait to see what they do next. this was a masterclass on how to do adaptations on video games.
what really made the show amazing was how they perfectly managed to fit the music to a certain scene.
music  detail  additional items in cyberpunk red
the line sorry, wish we could go to the moon together is more than enough to maske this show great

i especially think the proper in game locations were a really nice detail i mean they could have just made up a bunch of random locations that did t exist and just say that the cities layout changed between the show and the game but instead they went through the effort of using actual in game locations and thats really nice
as someone who didn't play the game and only watched the anime, i cant exactly pinpoint one thing that made me love it so much. everything is just perfect
the characters, all so distinct and entertaining
the relatability to the characters and the overall great storyline and animation

what i love about edgerunners is what i love about 2077 but just in anime form. the storytelling is superb, the song choices really fit the scenes, and the characters are just so cool with all their dynamics.

for me it was the writing and heart crushing story that made it so great and that it was in production before the game came out so they had time to pay attention to detail im really bad at rewatching shows and only ever done so with fmab and black lagoon but im thinking i might rewatch it soon
when david gets smashed by the smasher, that was the best part.

first 6 episodes made me want to play the game because it looked so cool. last episode made me need to play the game to find the most pain inducing weapon in the game to test it directly into adam smasher's cranium

the best thing about edgerunners is that it's a singleseason series. no waiting years for the story to continue while the show sits in production limbo and fans wonder if they'll ever get an ending, like so many other animated series end up. best of all, if someone watches edgerunners and wants to spend more time in that world, cyberpunk 2077 is a whole immersive deepdive into night city, and these days it's actually an awesome game instead of a glitchy mess.
and the end credits song is an absolute vibe to drive to at night

as someone who hadnt watched or played 2077 before watching the anime, i think the dynamic between the art style and the story is what i loved most, the animation is very colourful and vibrant while the story is very dark and mysterious, also cant forget i really want to stay at your house

i watched edgerunners after playing the game like 10 times. when i watched edgerunners and saw the details, it felt like the most immersive show i've ever watched. no other show or movie has been able to replicate it. that's why it's my favorite anime. rip david martinez
that feeling when you walk through the same spot our heros walked through all that time ago

its so amazing simply because of the attraction we had with every character, we knew their favorite drinks the david martinez at the afterlife, we knew what kind of clothes they wore, when the weeped we could feel that. it was like we knew them personally, we seen their dreams and ambitions, their struggles, their likes and dislikes, their progress physically and mentally, their ups and downs, thats what makes it so amazing as we felt everything they felt because we knew them in and out. thats what makes it so special. same with almost every other good showgame, the small details matter most and thats what cyberpunk is all about. small details.
this was like the first cyberpunk content i watched and fell in love with it and thinking about how its a year old makes me sad to think about

the spicy romance between lucy and david is what truly drove the show for me. when the show first came out, i thought it was just gonna be another generic video game adaptation with a bunch of oneoff characters who we all knew were gonna die, but no. i was shocked that i cared about every single moment, and the drama heating up between david and lucys relationship all leading up to that heartbreaking send off that many of us were not prepared for.

i loved that rogue and claire made a cameo in one of the scenes, plus in edgerunners they mention what happened in arasaka tower 50 years ago, so that make me thirsty for a prequel with jhonny silverhand himself

what made it truly special for me is that they didn't lean too heavily on night city being dark, gritty, and full of action. they really portrayed it like a living city, full of all kinds of people who have dreams, and people like david who wants to see people achieve their dreams. the writers could have easily made it a fullon shonen, but it's clear that the goal was to keep david grounded even until the very end when he's trying to fight cyberpsychosis.

becca. we all need a becca in our lives to support us through tough times. shes immortalized in my heart even if i blame her specifically for the ending we got. only reliable person with proper screen time yet she didnt step up after maine going haywire.

i only started playing cyberpunk in mid march. i am now over 360hrs in. bought phantom liberty after the hanako parade event and couldn't put it down since then. finally watched edgrunners in between my game and got even more hooked. can't tell you how gut wrenching it feels when i happen to drive by rebecca's apartment, or the buckaslice restaurant, where kiwi met her fate in back of the garbage bin. the dried blood is actually still there in game. ooof... cyberpunk 2077 is a damned masterpiece. it's hard to believe its the same game that was lambasted years ago for a really rough launch. the game plays quite well today. it's absolutely incredible.

have essentially become one and quite frankly i think johnny and v being two separate people is only because this new version of them both combined johnny with the memories of v or v with the memories of johnny is simply trying to process the two different entire lifetimes worth of memories into one cohesive understanding of themself and you could say this means that the both of them did die the second that the ship was put into v's head while they were still alive and probably also with the chipping damaged in a way that meant that johnny woke up before the transfer process finished parsley probably thinks to the fact that the brain it was connecting to was active thus then activating johnny in waking him up early as well but that's just how the human brain works for better or for worse in terms of us never being the same person we were even just yesterday and the person you were being dead in a manner of speaking and though this is a much faster and more forced method of this i recently completed it all...i feel like thr way i played my 1st playthrough as a nomad was perfect. it seems to be the most honest satisfying way. i literally did everything including the side missions, gigs, ncpd, bought all the apartments, etc. i just started a new1 as a street kid,  im playing it way more confrontational. the 1st playthrough i did less physical combat as possible. i was more of a netrunner  defeated most of my enemies through quick hacks  stealth...i felt alot less attached to jackie this playthrough. i think the mission as a nomad wher3 u  jackie took the ride to the border was an important bonding moment. that's why i feel like the nomad playthrough is the best one. ur not green but ur not corrupted by the city yet as a street kid or corpo would be. also the ending with panam was extremely satisfying...after being betrayed  kicked out by my own nomad gang  being taken in by panam  her nomad gang just felt right...i dont think ill pick a different way to end phantom liberty. regardless i'm not goin to portray songbird...whatever happens happens

ozob is based off of a character created by long time brazillian content creator azaghal, he made it for his cyberpunk tabletop rpg decades ago, and when witcher 3 was released he was invited by cdpr to cover the game, and during meetings with the team, had talks about adding him in an upcoming cyberpunk game, to which they did, adding ozob as an easter egg character. in the brazillian dub, ozob is voiced albeit very poorly, given he's no profissional va by azaghal himself.

fun fact this very mission there was a god mode glitch to permanently in god mode when you drop off the ozob get out and run fail the mission and then you'll be in permanent god mode but unfortunately it was patched in later updates but if you did it before it was patched you still in god mode today

there's a video on the jovem nerd channel when the creator, dave azaghal pazos, meets his creation in game he didn't know if ozob was gonna be in the game or not...he recorded the voice, but cdpr didn't confirm until releases. it's a very heartwarming moment to watch his reaction.

a little more context for this guy. in brazil, there is a podcast channel called jovem nerd, in which they had a very successful rpg campaign in the cyberpunk setting, similar to critical role. the breakout character was ozob, played by jovem nerd's cohost azagal. the character became so popular a line of merch about him, he got fan made and approved comics, and brazilians en mass asked cdpr to put him in the game. the cherry on top in the brazilian portuguese dub, his voice actor is actually azagal, and his lines in the english version are adapted from his catchphrases from portuguese, like the got some powder for my nose is d uma bitoca no meu nariz, or kiss my nose.
